Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Victoria F
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write hotel reviews but in this case I think it is very much deserved. We have just returned from a four day trip to Paris and I was very pleased with this hotel. The staff were incredibly polite and helpful throughout our stay; it's nice to see a Paris hotel that really 'gets' customer service. We arrived in Paris early in the morning and they allowed us to store our bags at the hotel even though check-in wasn't until 2 p.m. Likewise, on our final day they let us keep the bags at the hotel until our evening train which enabled us to make the most of our last day. The room itself was small but we were hardly there so that didn't matter. Both the room and bathroom were immaculate and were cleaned each day. There was a decent power shower and soft white towels which were replaced daily. Although the hotel was fully booked you wouldn't know it as the room was so peaceful. We slept with the window open but the only sound you could hear was the bells of a nearby church. The location is also fantastic. There are three metro stations within a stone's throw (Temple, Republique and Arts et Metiers) and many more within 5-10 minutes' walk. However, we walked nearly everywhere as everything was so accessible. All in all, we had no complaints and I would readily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: ZANA88
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day trip to Paris and stayed in this wonderful hotel with the friendliest and most helpful staff you could ever wish to meet. Our room was small but as we had come for a sightseeing trip we only used to sleep in - and for that it was more than adequate. It was cleaned daily, the towels were changed and the shower was powerful with plenty of hot water. The breakfast was great and there was plenty of choice - it was buffet style, you could eat as much as you like and it was all freshly prepared (no stale croissants or hard bread). We ate twice in the restaurant across the road called the "Cafe Bar Le Temple." It's eclectic decor consists of leopard skin and movie star photographs (and we even spotted some lacy knickers and handcuffs) but the food is WONDERFUL. We also tried the "10" restaurant (situated at the Crowne Plaza hotel) which although beautifully decorated in a contemporary style did not (in our opinion) have the quality of food of other Parisian restaurants that we tried. The staff were very friendly and efficient but the food was a major letdown. Le Relais du Marais has 2 Metro stations virtually on its doorstep but we walked everywhere as the hotel is so central for all the attractions. A wonderful stay and many thanks to the owner and his staff for all their help and advise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: drantics
Reviews.Content: After much internet research, this hotel was settled upon. It was the first Euro hotel I had ever stayed in, so it was a change. My friend and I stayed here for a week. The room was small, but cozy. It was pretty clean, no complaints with that. Nothing special with decor, no big deal. The room had a beautiful little 'juliet balcony' which was awesome! A good place to chill in the evening with a glass of wine after a long day of site-seeing! My only complaint was the washroom door.. No idea why they would put a glass door in there, it wasn't very private at all and wouldn't stay shut. But no reason to not stay here. The service was great, easy check-in and check-out. Always there to offer advice. They even let us borrow a wine opener for an evening! Definitely bring a wine opener with you whilst traveling. WIFI was good. We didn't get breakfast because there's so many lovely cafes everywhere. The location was awesome as well, the best part was that it wasn't 'touristy' at all.. No flaming tourists bouncin around if ya know what I mean. It was in short walking distance to plenty of delicious restaurants and cafes. A grocery store around the corner and plenty of great shops (clothing, shoes, etc). Also very close to metro stations which was key. Nearby was the St. Martin canal which was beautiful at night! Went there with a little picnic we made up of cheeses, bread, fruit and wine from the nearby grocer.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty bijou hotel”
Reviews.Author: hometutor
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty hotel in Paris with a metro station within 2 mms walk. Located within walking distance of many attractions. The hotel itself is run by very helpful and friendly staff and is very clean and well kept. Our room was on the top floor and overlooked the street but traffic could hardly be heard. The views from our balcony overlooked typical Parisian architecture and the hotel itself was tasteful and modern. The morning breakfast restaurant was bright and always well stocked with a selection of croissants and petit pains. The bedroom itself was of average size and the bathroom had the prettiest stained glass door which gave the room a larger appearance. Flat screen TV complimented the decor. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a weekend in Paris. The only negative, as with most hotels, is that the maids tend to start hoovering early in the morning (7.30 ish) which isn't so bad as it eradicates the need for an early morning call!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_Leonard
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on extensive research through Trip Advisor. This hotel met all my needs - close to two metro stations, close to Gard du Nord (we caught train from London), safe location (I was travelling with my young daughter) and reasonably priced. We were extremely happy with this hotel. It was very clean. The room was small but well equipped. The bathroom was spotless (looked freshly renovated). We had a room overlooking the street but the window was double glazed and there was no traffic noise. There is a lift as well as stairs so hauling luggage is not a problem. It was also warm! Which was a bonus given the temperature outside! Front desk staff were very friendly and very helpful, providing good advice on transport and timing. Other advantages included a large supermarket around the corner, a sushi restaurant directly opposite and many shops and cafes within walking distance. We ate breakfast in the hotel on the first morning and on subsequent days just bought pastries at the stores around the corner. We had no complaints and would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hideaway in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanSoul
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was value for money, clean and well maintained with free WiFi and a range of English TV channels. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast (extra charge) was of a good standard. Conveniently located near two Metro stations (Temple and Republique) for getting around Paris. However, you need to negotiate a line change to get there if you are arriving in Paris by plane or TGV.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Graham_J0hn
Reviews.Content: We stayed into this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of January. I booked it through Eurostar, when I was arranging the train trip to Paris. The woman who was taking my booking recommened it very highly. I, cynically, thought that this was this just part of the sale patter she had to give. However, when we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. It is well situated close to a metro station and the Marais district, which is our favourite part of Paris. The staff were friendly and efficient and I'm sure would have been very helpful if we had needed any help. Our room was very clean, if somewhat small, but that is a common problem with Parisian hotels. The en-suite bathroom also rather crammed and looked as though it could do with some maintaince work. However, it was also very clean. Overall, for a weekend stay the hotel was perfectly adequate, but I don't think I would have liked to stayed there for a longer time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, can highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: twentyfourthworld
Reviews.Content: + Very friendly reception staff who were more than happy to help + Spotlessly clean room, fresh towels given regularly + A small fridge to chill drinks + Hot, powerful shower + A nice balcony with the typical Paris streets view + Quiet hotel, didn't hear any noise from other rooms + Located right next to two metros, Temple and Republique + Walking distance to the bars and clubs of le Marais + Always nice to have McDonald's and supermarket on the doorstep too! Overally I loved the hotel! I stayed for two nights in January and got a good deal (200 euros for the two nights). I know the going rate is 150euro per night, I have to admit if I had paid the full rate I may have expected a little more - but if you can get the deal, STAY HERE! Location is great, the important thing is its proximity to a Metro (although admittedly not the best metros, felt like all we did was change trains trying to get on the right line to the hotel). Highly recommended, have stayed in several 2 star hotels in Paris and this far outstrips the others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: sooraiya
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful. The hotel is situated in a very good location. Got a lot of sightseeing tips from the staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SoloSojouner
Reviews.Content: Le Relais is a good value in a good location in Paris. The staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful. The room was quiet and very clean. The breakfast was good with a nice variety of things to choose. Close to the Temple and Republique metros stops makes this hotel easy to get to from the airport and Gare du Nord. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: LuciaGrosner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Relais du Marais in May 2011. The best feature of this hotel is the location, walking distance to many attractions, and very close to two subway stations. The rooms themselves are very tiny, but clean, and that's the most important in my opinion. I stayed four nights and payed 352 Euros, or 486 Canadian dollars, which I think was a very good deal for Paris. The staff was nice, the manager offered me his fridge to keep my vegan food (not easy to find in France). I'd certainly recommend it, if you find a good price as I did, and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: hugoolbpp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Even though the room is quite small and the price is not so affordable for a two-stars hotel, people say ALL hotels in Paris are smaller and more expensive than similar places in other countries. And the location of this one is great! "Temple" station is just around the corner, literally. Since the metro system in Paris is very good, you can go from the hotel to almost anywhere in the town in less than 15 minutes (unless you are going to venues like Versailles). Moreover, Marais is an amazing neighborhood, very beautiful and lively - yet, Rue du Turbigo is not noisy. Staff is very helpful. For instance: one day, we had a medical problem, and they kindly offered to call a doctor, since we didn't speak French very well - and we were certainly nervous. There is a nice balcony, which allows a superb view to the neighborhood. Some minor problems: the elevator is very small, it will probably not have enough place for you and your luggage; the bathroom door is strangely transparent; the maid may wake you up early morning even if you ask her not to - it happened once. However, these features don't affect the good experience at all. We didn't try the breakfast, therefore I can't evaluate it. Given all that, I thoroughly recommend Le Relais du Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nordavind_Italy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a very good location to move around in the city (close to place de la République and at 50 mt from the Temple metro station), especially if you like to walk (15min.to Notre Dame). It is near to the Marais and all it's bars/restaurants. In the hotel we must say that room and bathroom are VERY small but everything is ok, especially: - cleanliness - nice design furniture As a plus a mention goes to the kind people at the reception and to the free wi-fi connection available to the guests. Breakfast is available (10€ person/day) but if you prefer in the nearby you can spare same money going to the cafès and asking for a breakfast menu (about 7-9€). It is a 2-star cozy hotel with a budget price (lower if compared to the closest competitors) that we'd suggest for a stay into the 'ville lumière'!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: LordEddardStark
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here early December 2011 for 2 nights on a short midweek break. It is located really close to the Republique and Temple Metro stops that can be accessed from the airport via a change at Gard dud Nord. The staff were helpful and gave us the best and biggest room (64) as they were quiet and it was free. This room was a nice size but a hotel in Paris is simply for the sleep so really a good bed, shower and room for the case is all you need ! It was a great base for exploring as Notre Dame and the Louvre are 15 mins walk away and the Metro makes everywhere accessible. The Breakfast was simple but great, with a selection of coissant, bread, cheese, cereal and coffee/fruit juice, as much as you like. Eating wise I'd recommend Pramil (just accross the road) for an upmarket french meal, this was fantatic at 30 euros for 3 courses. For a more laid back eatery the Buffalo Grill is also accross the road and is an American Themed Restaurant and the food is excellent also. I'd gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 825alexander825
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris for over 30 years and was really too short i was impressed with the staff as they were really helpful and were really imformative in every way the room was small and for me quite quirky which was on the 6th floor the breakfast was quite basic but was ok for me good location for getting around i would reccommend it and would stay here if ever i came back and there was a nice cafe and a mini market just down the road

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably cheap for Paris, small, well located”
Reviews.Author: SiameseDuke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through British Airways (we were spending our Air Miles before they add the taxes!). Basic two-star hotel, ideally located five minutes' walk from the Place de la Republique. Loads of restaurants, shops etc within a few minutes' walk, in the Marais. OK, so we had a free trip, but I overheard the receptionist quoting a price of 80 euros a night for a room on the telephone, and for Central Paris, that's cheap. Very small rooms, or ours was anyway, but very clean. No restaurant. Better than average breakfast (croissants, pains au chocolate, bread, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, on a buffet basis). Good functioning wifi in the rooms. Oh, avoid the Cafe Absinthe a few yards down the street, and recommended by the hotel for dinner. Expensive and decidedly mediocre. Much better places available nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: JJMontreal2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at le Relais du Marais for 3 nights. The staffs at the hotel were very nice and helpful and allowed us to choose between 2 hotel rooms for our stay. The room is decent european hotel room, which means that it is very small for north american standard. Our bathroom was recently renovated so it was nice and very clean. The same cannot be said with regard to the carpet of the room itself (we wish it could have been replaced at the same time they re-did the tiles of the bathroom. We saw complains on tripadvisor about the quality of the wireless internet. We had no issues with it. We were on 2nd floor of the hotel and they seem to have a hotspot for each floor. Connection was easy and speed was ok. The hotel is very well located. It is 2 minutes away from subway Republique and easy to access. It is within walking distance of notre dame de paris and seine. We had no complains regarding noise. Our room was facing street and when the windows are open, it could be very noisy. However when the windows are closed, it is quiet. You could hear people using their bathrooms from other rooms or floors but this is common with all hotel rooms and I recently experienced the same in a hilton hotel. The best thing is to bring your own ear plugs. The one thing we did not like with the hotel is the fact that you have to leave your room key with the front desk every time you leave the hotel. We were kind of surprised that every time we asked for our rooms keys, the clerk did not check with our identity and just gave us our room keys, kind of scary if you consider that the clerks change every few hours so we had few new faces to give us keys. However, we have a good experience with le relais du marais and we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect Petit hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: prescriptiondog
Reviews.Content: I decided to go for another short four night trip to Paris in summer. As hotels in Paris are very overpriced I found it again very difficult to find something that felt like good value. Le Relais du Marais offered a good value offer through expedia. On arrival, and probably as I was travelling alone, I was put into a small room without direct daylight. The window was facing a lightwell and other room windows so I had to keep my blinds closed. The other light into the room came only through the glass door to the bathroom, which luckily was not an issue staying by myself. I decided to ask for another room as I didnt feel for the price this was where I would want to stay even for four nights. I believe that even at £100 a night you can still expect something more than that. The hotel staff was a bit hesitant in offering me a different room so I had to wait until the morning. The change in room was better, now facing the front of the hotel and with plenty of light, but space was something to be desired as well as very dated decor. Anyway, I decided to stay put for now. There was also seriously bad sound insulation between rooms, I could hear people coming back late at night and talking in the room next door. Not great. Also, the breakfast was very, very minimal in a super small breakfast area offering only a small choice of pastries and packaged cheeses and yoghurts. Eggs were only available every other day. All in all, I would not come back. If you do decide and book it, just dont expect much. It is okay but simply just okay. I still believe that at that rate, more can be expected. With regards to location, the hotel is 15min walking distance from Gare du Nord as well as easy walking distance (10mins) to the Marais, but not central in the Marais as the name might suggest. I hope this review is helpful for some!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great value for money - Wonderful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: anthonybassett
Reviews.Content: For a city hotel, this has a great deal to offer, it's very close to the metro, Temple and Republic, the latter is a short ride from Gare du Nord if you're coming in on the RER from Charles de Gaulle, Orly or the Eurostar. A large supermarket directly behind and a couple of smaller ones along the street as well as an Asian minimarket just a few doors along, which was great as we were back late on the Sunday evening when the supermarkets were closed but luckily the minimarket was still open. The guys running it are very warm and friendly and they have a good sense of humour! We walked to Notre Dame from the hotel, it took just over 20 minutes, we also walked back to the hotel from the Louvre, which is no big deal. The areas you're walking in all feel safe, however there are a few beggars but they don't get into your face. Plenty of reasonably priced food places nearby. The rooms at this hotel are cosy, but quite big enough. towels were changed daily, the room was cleaned daily. If I want to find criticism, of course I can find it, the maid missed dusting the reading lights over the bed - big deal! The bedroom carpet had some stains on it, which is a shame, because I think that otherwise it was in good condition, but that was because a previous guest was dirty, but it's a shame the hotel doesn't do something about this - perhaps they tried? In the bathroom I noticed a little mould on the silicone, a little bleach would definately get rid of that. That was my winge. Would I stay here again, definately, would I recommend this hotel, without doubt! The staff here are really friendly and helpful, they have a baggage room and checkout isn't until 12.00. Breakfast is excellent, pain au chocolate, croisents, bread, toast, boiled eggs, cereal, cheese, plenty of coffee, tea, hot chocolate, help yourself. To summarise, this is a city centre hotel, very conveniently located. It is essentially clean, the beds are very comfortable. the staff are genuinely warm and friendly. The hotel is great value for money. I have no hesitation of recommending it. I've listed above some minor points but I've given an even and honest review. Finally if you're planning to visit a few of the museums around Paris, I very stronly suggest that you consider buying a "Museum Pass" although it seems to be a lot of money, we got great value from it, we spend €50.00 and would have spent a lot more had we paid for everything individually but another great bonus is that with the pass, in many cases you miss the queue. These can be quite long! If you're planning to visit Ile de la cite to see Notre Dame, which is of course wonderful, DO NOT MISS "Sant Chapel" this has to be the most beautiful building in all of Paris - google it and find out about it, if this doesn't win your heart, then you have no soul.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place”
Reviews.Author: Margo M
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at this hotel. As others have mentioned, the staff are extremely helpful and nice. For example, our son got sick and had to spend the day at the hotel, and they let him Facebook the day away on their computer while he was hotel-bound, and they steered me to a nearby pharmacy, where the pharmacist was highly professional. St. Elisabeth church is nearby, and we got to hear their choir practicing one Friday night - it was beautiful! We will definitely stay here again for our short annual visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Sica_11
Reviews.Content: Good location near Republique. The decoration of some rooms is arqueable, but it is clean and good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: HannahGrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights hotel in this hotel last easter. We decided upon this hotel after having read all the positive reviews here on TA. The hotel was definitely value for money, the location is great, the rooms are ok sized (hey, it's Paris!!) and clean and the staff is really friendly. Definitely didn't feel like a 2 star hotel. A couple of things could be improved, though: -The free wifi almost never functioned. The signals are so low, our iPhone and iPad hardly ever managed to make contact with it. -Breakfast is definitely not worth the money. (We hadn't paid for breakfast in our stay, but got it for free one of the mornings because of a leakage in our bathroom) White toastbread, sliced cheese in plastic bags, jam in small packages and terrible coffee. And that's it- nothing else is served! Better to buy breakfast at one of the many bakeries nearby. But overall, a nice experience, and astonishingly cheap in a city where nearly everything you buy will leave a hole in your wallet..!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely better than a 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: ringingup
Reviews.Content: We ended up booking this hotel as we needed a relatively cheap accommodation in the centre that would be clean and presentable. I wouldn't normally stay in a 2 star hotel, but - given the reviews - I was more than happy to book it. The hotel looks nice when you get in and the room was reasonably sized and very clean. Very well served by the metro, with one stop just 10 steps away and another one only a 3 minute walk away. Unfortunately we didn't manage to make the free wifi work.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and basic but good enough.”
Reviews.Author: MrMark68
Reviews.Content: Had such a great time in Paris only used it as a bed which really was all it could be used for. Pretty good location bit of a walk to tourist spots but good way to burn off the croissants. Would definately go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, except for the bathroom glass door.”
Reviews.Author: danielcohn3736
Reviews.Content: The place is neat, the location is very good with a big (in European terms) supermarket just behind the hotel plus if you keep kosher, you are within walking distance from kosher bakeries and kosher supermarket. The only problem is the bathroom slide glass door (though not completely transparent).

Reviews.Title: “Great people”
Reviews.Author: ritazm
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a week in June 2011 and recommend it highly. The accommodations are not luxurious, but very clean, comfortable, and attractive. The location is great -- an interesting area within easy reach of the Metro and walking distance of many sites. The main attraction of the Relais is the staff. They are wonderful -- cheerful, warm, and very helpful. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to discover Paris, rooms great so lone as you don't spend too much time in them”
Reviews.Author: Suzioz
Reviews.Content: Was booked here by travel agent. oom tiny but the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. room very quiet with doors closed, even though we faced street. Bathroom couldn't swing a cat in, and the shower screen directed water all over floor!! However. Managed very well and was creative in storage department . Room could do with a chest of drawersunder table as there was barely enough room to store two pele clothes. breakfasts were fine, but a couple of mornings we went out and had a more traditional local breakfast in cafes. the hotel is next to two metro lines that take you wherever you need to go, and we walked to and from Pompedu Centre very easily.Would highly recommend this hotel to people who are planning to be out all day and not planning to spend much time in their room.

Reviews.Title: “one could try for other options in 7th arrondissment”
Reviews.Author: vanidaya
Reviews.Content: The rooms were too tiny, double occupancy rooms have just got enough space to move around the bed. We had two rooms, the one with triple occupancy was better. Its better to eat breakfast outside the hotel. There is a big supermarket at the back side of the hotel which has amazing bakery stuff for the morn breakfast. This hotel is close to the metro stop but one should try and locate around some other hotels in the same price. This was not such a great property.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful find thanks trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: bayarea000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located perfectly for getting around paris and great for the area it is in. lots of restaurants and discoveries within walking distance. rooms were clean, ok size. mine was on the first floor right on the street. i thought it would be noisy. with the window open it was city noisy during the day. when i closed the window the double glazed windows made it almost silent. amazing. staff was very friendly. advance booking got us a 77 euro per nite rate . free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if you can't afford the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Queenie_RedRose
Reviews.Content: The title says it all - this hotel is in an excellent location in easy reach of the Louvre and Opera regions and has very good transport connections to enable you to travel further afield easily. The staff at the hotel were all extremely helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel itself is quirky (in a good way) and very comfortable. The rooms are small but as a sleeping base and somewhere to get ready for a night out, it is more than adequate. The room/bathroom were always very clean and the room also had a mini fridge which is something not all large chain hotels provide so that was a bonus for us. The rooms were air conditioned and had a flat screen tv (no english speaking channels but was fun to see what we could understand). The only potential issue I could find (if I was picky) is that the bathroom has a frosted glass door which doesn't give you much privacy but luckily my partner and I have been together for a long time and so weren't too worried about this! Breakfast was included in my stay and was really convenient as it meant we could go back to the room and get ready for the day out after our breakfast. There isn't a huge amount of choice but plenty of fresh food available such as croissants, yoghurts and boiled eggs. Tips for things to do/places to go during your stay would be as follows: OpenTour open top bus trip - around £29 for the full day, 50 stops along 4 routes in Paris and you can get on and off as many times as you like. Louvre - absolutely amazing experience, don't let the sight of the queues put you off as the staff are incredibly efficient. Make sure you brave the crowds to get a glimpse of the Mona Lisa. Eagle - a fantastic gay bar on Rue St Denis (around 10 mins from hotel). Staff and other clientele were extremely friendly and welcoming. Not to mention the super strength, great value cocktails (around £5). Chez Omar - amazing couscous restaurant around 5 mins from hotel. They don't take reservations and you will have to wait for a table but it is well worth the wait! The Royal couscous was around £24 and you would not need a starter or a dessert if you go for this option! Cafe de Temple - an excellent Corsican restaurant across the road from the hotel. The decoration of the restaurant is somewhat 'different' and looks like a shrine to Marilyn Monroe. If you don't let this put you off then you will have an amazing meal. My tip is the beef fillet with shallots. Overall I would definitely choose this hotel again. One final tip - don't bother to arrange an airport transfer. We paid £60 for a shuttle transfer (one other couple) from and to the airport and it really wasn't worth it. The transport connections are so convenient that you can easily catch a train to Gare du Nord station and then the Metro to Temple (even if you have a big suitcase).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal centrally located 2 star hotel for a short stay, business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: sva777
Reviews.Content: Small, well run hotel, which was quiet and central, near Republique and short distance from Gare du Nord and the main tourist sites as well. Rooms were of adequate size and the beds very comfortable, with great linen sheets and duvet covers. Noticed that each room has a different theme. Airconditioned and breakfast included, so was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly staff, small room, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: LauraV1215
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and the staff were very helpful and friendly. We used 2 rooms and as I requested right next to each other. Although small, they were sufficient - until the 2 people I was traveling with using the other room had a non-working shower. Luckily they borrowed ours. The pictures as seen on the website differ from the actual rooms. The location is not terrible - about a 20 minute walk from the Louvre and Notre Dame. It is located near a Monoprix (to which we aptly nicknamed 'target' said in French accent). Overall - I can recommend this hotel to a budget minded traveler.

Reviews.Title: “cosy little place”
Reviews.Author: dimithri1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel around christmas time. We really apreciated the help of ALL the staff at the hotel. They were very nice to us and very friendly. The room although small was very cosy. We did have loud neighbour's ...if you know what I mean...thin walls..hehe..after all it's the city of love...The bathroom had a glass door to it which is something my wife wasn't very happy with and I had to be out in the balcony while she was using it...:) The breakfast area was very nice and modern but they could have had a few cold cuts like salami and cheese for breakfast instead of just bread butter and jam....Excellent connections to the city...2 metro stations close by and good local amenities and restaurants and bars around....Lovely stay

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: Gabriellafe67
Reviews.Content: The hotel design is realy nice. However, it begins to seem the work of the "iron teeth of the time". There are still a small abrasions, would be nice to fix them. The bathroom tub's insulating silicone starts to become black. The dining room white wood lighting cover's is slightly peeling. The wi-fi from the beginning faltered, then completely stopped to work in the weekend. Despite all experiences the hotel is highly recommended - good location, nice atmosphere, good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Indypuss
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Relais du Marais, and we're congratulating ourselves on such a great find. It's just 200m from the Place de Republic, only 3 metro stops from the Gare du Nord (Eurostar). The rooms are above average for a 2* Paris hotel, small but nicely furnished, with fairly new bathrooms and bright furnishings. Our room (42) had a double bed, small wardrobe, TV, and small but spotless bathroom with a double-sized shower with door, (not just a curtain). The rooms were very clean, serviced every day, lovely fluffy towels replaced each day. A double french window opens to a view over the busy street below. Traffic noise is high during the day as you would expect from Paris but quiet at night and anyway the windows are double-glazed so it's not a problem. The reception staff speak English and there's a lift to save your weary legs. Breakfast was a bit steep at 10 euros, but there are plenty of cafes etc on your doorstep offering continental fare at 8 euros or less. Try the Croissanterie across the road for pastries juice and coffee at about 6 euros each. Our only complaint was that there is no safe in the room and it's 4 euros per day to rent a box at reception - haggle with the reception staff for a cheaper rate! Location - Temple metro station (line 3) is almost outside, or walk 200m to Republic station for 4 lines taking you all over Paris. We walked to Notre Dame and the river via the Pompidou Centre in just over 20 minutes, and Bastille is just as close. The Marais quarter is on the doorstep with all its cafes and boutique shops. Eating Out - There are plenty of bars and restaurants in Place de Republique, catering mainly for the American and Japanese tourists who stay at the Crowne Plaza. Our only bad food experience was at Pizza Pino - 12euros for a salad consisting of one tomato a few slices of mozzarella and a few olives, and indifferent service. OUR TIP - catch line 3 from Temple to Bourse and try the many restaurants in the 'Passages' leading towards the Grands Boulevards (but get there by 7pm to get a good table). Getting Around - The OpenTour on the double decker bus is great on a nice day, but not much fun when it's cold as everyone huddles on the lower deck and you can't see anything..and very slow during the rush hour. The Metro is easy and cheap - unless you're a museum addict (try the Paris Visite card) the best way is to buy a Carnet of 10 tickets from the automated machines at each station (cash or cards accepted). Our favourite sights - The Eiffel Tower from the Trocadero Metro (it's the view on the postcards), Bercy Village (amazingly peaceful gardens and converted wine warehouses with restaurants and shops), the Paris Mosquee by the Jardin du Plantes (try the restaurant for tagines to die for and wonderful mint tea) We had a great stay at the Relais du Marais and would recommend it if you're looking for a reasonably-priced, clean, no frills, well-located hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel I've stayed in in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pauncefoot
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Relais Du Marais during half term to celebrate her birthday. The hotel was without fault. The staff were delightful and very friendly. The hotel was immaculate and full of character. It was well placed for the Marais and there was an excellent choice of restaurants to hand (not to mention a Monoprix and a Tatti). The inclusive breakfast was great. The staff even allowed us to keep our bags there until the evening on the day we flew home! I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “the staff and facilities were 'GREAT'”
Reviews.Author: schestatzky
Reviews.Content: two weeks before arriveing i was in contact by mail with the reception staff and they were super kindly and professional in there sugerences and help!!!! rooms are clean, bathrooms new and comfortable breakfast full and fresh what else we need in a 6 days vacations? we were 6 adults in 3 doble rooms and all of us enjoy and sugest this hotel again because the warm staff and the hotel himself!! miguel jerusalem february 2011

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: BobHouk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, by the Republique, easily accessed from the Metro, with many super restaurants and interesting attractions nearby. (take note the Museum of inventions is 1 block away) The rooms are clean, workable space, a relatively modern bathroom and a cheerful appearence. The breakfast offered by the hotel is worth the extra 10E with a cute seating area, loby and small private work area. What we found most outstanding was the invaluable friendly advice of the multilingual staff. They were simply marvelous: providing insight, tips on transportation and restaurant recommendations. Each of them helped make our Parisian vacation a seamless experience. If you're looking for a great value, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good basic hotel, nice location!”
Reviews.Author: migratorychic
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and the reviews were generally very accurate... down-to-earth staff, TINY clean rooms (very happy with the shower and tub!). If your purpose is to have a basic, clean "base" from which you will be exploring Paris like crazy, this place is PERFECT! I had to give the rooms only a 3/5 rating because they really a tiny and the bathroom door is a sliding frosted glass door. If either you or your travel buddy get the runs, the other person would have to stand outside (or on the balcony if your room has one)! Of course, the room size is to be expected in Europe and for the price, I was quite pleased with everything. The two twin beds were also very small (with an inch gap between them), but I have to say, the sleep was quite comfortable and the beds, despite their humble size, were quite supportive. In-room Wi-fi is rather slow and the lobby wi-fi is marginally better. But you're in Paris! Unplug already :P Breakfast is rather charming. The mini-croissants were excellent and there is a mini-fridge stocked with a variety of cheeses, yogourts and compotes. By the way, the location is great. On a nice day, you can walk to the Montorgueil area in around 20 minutes. Nice stroll. The "Temple" metro station is literally out the door and "Replublique" metro is a 2 minute walk. If you want fresh fruit, there is a Monoprix across the street from the "Temple" metro entrance. If you exit the Relais and turn right, next door is a very good (and equally tiny) Japanese restaurant for easy, quick, non-dairy-intensive meals for those of you sick of the camembert baguettes: yes, it can happen!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris on a budget?”
Reviews.Author: ggarnczarczyk
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean base to explore Paris. This is a good place to start. If you can look past the triangular mirrors and dated compact rooms. Breakfast was funkier and reception leads you to think the hotel is boutique. The boutique ends here I'm afraid. That said the shower was powerful the staff were friendly. It's paris on a budget If explorings your bag.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great and the hosting even better!”
Reviews.Author: MichalTal
Reviews.Content: The staff is kind and friendly. The rooms are small but comfortable. The breakfast is fine. The location is great. If you want to see paris and you need a place to stay over the nights, Le Relais du Marais can be your choise!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for 2-3 days tourists -”
Reviews.Author: Sanat_Satyan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a colleague in Paris as it was cheap & well located when it came to proximity to a major metro station is concerned. The Republique station has 7 lines merging at it, helping one to reach any part of Paris without changing trains. The hotel is small and nice. We chose a non-street view room - although it was small, but it was not at all noisy, allowing us to catch up some sleep between sight seeing trips. The street-view rooms are also nice with a small balcony. Hotel staff was friendly. There are several nice small restaurants nearby for a quick snack. The complimentary breakfast in Marais is also pretty decent. Plus, it is close from Nord station. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel, nice people, but Wifi doesn't work for macs”
Reviews.Author: stuyvesant74
Reviews.Content: They gave me a quiet room at first, but I couldn't get wireless service, so they moved me to a noisy one. However, that didn't work either. They said that no one else was having problems. I could get a connection in the lobby, however, and guess what, I noticed 2 other people with macs down there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and price!”
Reviews.Author: MarlonDias
Reviews.Content: Nice stay. Located near Temple metro station - easy to go to top must-go places in Paris. A very good cost/benefit ratio!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with great service, good location and clean.”
Reviews.Author: sewfancy4
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent with all desk staff speaking English and attentive to our requests and needs. The room was small but adequate. We had expected this. The decor was nice, with ironing board and hair dryer. In the Marais section there are many small cafes nearby with good, reasonably priced food and diverse shopping opportunities. But the best feature was the chic room for petit dejuener (breakfast) with a snappy red, black and white decor. The selection of breakfast items was broad enough to suit most tastes, from cereal to hard boiled eggs, croissants, cheese, yogurt, coffee and juice. The attendants were always cheerful and helpful, and speaking little English did not negatively affect our experience- in fact it enhanced it. We had a street facing room, so street noise was sometimes a problem, so ask for a back room if you are a light sleeper. I was also disappointed that there were no adapters available so I could not use my computer.

Reviews.Title: “very small room, but comfortable bed and good shower, close to metro”
Reviews.Author: bigtripaug2010
Reviews.Content: the hotel was 2 star, very small room and bathroom and if you are a bit claustrophobic you will not like the elevator, but there are stairs. Breakfast was ok, but limited and when it ran out there didnt appear any 'topping up' It is in the marais district - arts district, so quite funky and close to the metro. Wasnt too noisy and a lovely little balcony outside your window. An outside street lamp meant the bathroom door had to be shut at night - otherwise it was like daylight. One staff member in particular - a male, cant remember his name - went out of his way to help us, thank you. Approx $AU200 per night, fairly expensive for a two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SuusWis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a couple of friends and we were all very happy with it. Rooms are quite big for Parisian standards, hotel is clean, breakfast is better than you might expect and the location is great. We loved the neighbourhood and as said by other visitors; go and eat at Le Vertbois (@rue du Vertbois, across the street), delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a 2*”
Reviews.Author: orangekss
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and the bargain price! There are a lot of 4* hotels that get a lower rating than this place! For a 2* Hotel I think it was very good.... It doesn't look much from the outside and some of the interior is a little quirky but the room was comfortable, well decorated and clean. It even has aircon. My only complaint would be that the room was quite small but lets face it, you will spend most of your time out, exploring the fabulous city. With the Metro so close it doesn't take long to get to the heart of things either. The service was very good and all the staff seemed very friendly. In a city that has a bit of a reputation for being unfriendly its nice to receive a warm welcome.... Though to be honest we found the Parisians to be very nice and the majority of service, good. The included breakfast was also good, enough to set you up for a morning's exploring. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Perhaps it's not 5* chic but it's a good, honest, comfortable and cheap base in Paris and just what we want.... we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located”
Reviews.Author: paddyschecter
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from a weekend break in Paris. The main benefit of this hotel is its really well located - served by really close metro. You can walk to the Seine in about 30 mins and Gare Du Nord is also about 20 mins walk away. August is traditionally a quiet time as the Parisians head off on their holidays so not every restaurant/cafe/bar was open, but plenty to explore. As for the Hotel - was just looking for somewhere that was safe, clean and cheap., I had a single room and it was small but perfect for my needs

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel - clean, friendly, well situated”
Reviews.Author: dawnus75
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of previous tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly - we asked if we could change rooms for the second night (our first room was no.11, on same floor as breakfast room so a bit noisy from 6am onwards but even then nothing we couldn't cope with) and the lady on reception immediately moved us to a room higher up with a balcony. The rooms are small, but you're in Paris - you should only be sleeping there! Our aircon worked in both rooms, as did the TV. However I have to agree with a comment from another reviewer about the bathroom door - in our first room it didn't shut properly, and in both rooms it amounted to no more than a frosted glass panel directly opposite the loo. This is not the place for a first weekend away together as you get very little bathroom privacy! For the price I can't complain about much else - breakfast was typically continental and more than adequate to get you started for the day, they have a luggage room and you can rent a safe for 4 euros a day. All in all a great hotel for the price, close to metro stations and 15-20 minutes walk from the Hotel de Ville, Louvre and the general centre of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shez12
Reviews.Content: Locations was very close to Republic Metro (which is one of the less crowded stops) and was very safe during day and night. Cute rooms with standard amenities. We got a balcony which was nice! The owner was friendly although the breakfast lady seemed a bit annoyed, but that's the french for ya! Breakfast had a good range and there was a lovely small terrace area. Room was air-conditioned and had good water pressure. A very small lift to the rooms is better than no lift at all! Wifi is available free of charge as well! Only downside is the funky glass door leading to the shower and the showerscreen which didn't work very well (doesn't really keep the water in the tub well). Overall, a pleasant stay would recommend for people who are looking for clean and affordable accom in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Basic but good Value”
Reviews.Author: GaryW4
Reviews.Content: We were invited to Paris for a long weekend with a group of friends, 1 of which recommended this Hotel for value and location as she'd stayed there before. Our room was about as small as a double can get but was clean and at the back of the building so didn't suffer from the road noise other reviewers have mentioned. Bed was strangely high but comfortable, air conditioning didn't seem to work but we never complained, just opened the window. The staff seemed friendly except the lady in the breakfast room one morning who seemed to enjoy banging the dishes around very loudly, she also put a tray on our table and said something in French, no idea what? Think she was implying we must use a tray and clear our table ourselves when we were finished. The food was pretty basic, cereals, yoghurt's, bread, toaster, juice etc, but good enough start to the day. Hotel is located fairly centrally in Paris, about 20 min walk from Louvre, there are Metro Station's minutes away making it really easy to get around. Overall I found the hotel fine for our needs, I'd stay there again, its basic but good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with cool staff”
Reviews.Author: ianross
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with my daughter ( aged 19 )...Our room ( Number 33) was VERY small ( traditional in Paris, I concede ) but VERY clean. On the downside it featured an almost see-through bathroom door.......now, I don't care who you are sharing a room with, you do need a measure of privacy...the problem was solved by draping a blanket over the door. The staff were really, really friendly and very helpful. The breakast ( which was included in my very cheap room-rate ) was excellent. Location is slightly misleading - it may technically be the Marais ....but only just.... Even so, it was very good value for money and we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: IngaBKaunas
Reviews.Content: Hotel ir very close Paris city heart, Pompidou centre, Seine river, Notre Dame. There is two metro stations just few steps from the door. Rooms are very clean and conditioned, breakfast excellent and nice. Personal always lovely and helpful. The street is not very noisy and safe. I with my husband spent unforgettable time in Paris....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: TheThomas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights (Sat - Mon). We arrived early in Paris but it was no trouble getting booked in early. We would have been quite happy to leave the luggage in the baggage room and return later, but the receptionist was happy to book us in. The room, on the fifth floor, with balcony was excellent for the star rating. It was bright and cheerfull and spotlessly clean. Tea and coffee makings would have been a nice touch and that is really the only criticism. I had read about the traffic noise, but the double glazing took care of that and the air conditioning system kept the room cool. Breakfast, was plentiful and there was plenty of choice. The location was just great. From the front door to the hotel to Temple Metro station was literally 30 seconds and to Republique, two minutes and only a twenty minute walk to the Louvre. Would reccommend to anyone and certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, all you could want for a short stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: banditManchester
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were welcomed and assisted. The room we were given was excellent, the staff were wonderful and we would return again when visiting Paris

Reviews.Title: “A good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMACheshire
Reviews.Content: There is nothing out of the ordinary about this hotel (apart from the eclectic decor) but it served us perfectly well. It is well located for transport around Paris with three metro stations within easy reach (Temple is only 50 yards away) and a bus stop to Pont Neuf directly opposite the hotel. The room was small but it had adequate wardrobe and drawer space along with a functional bathroom. Initially we were given a room at the front of the hotel overlooking Rue De Turbigo. Nice aspect, but the traffic noise is considerable. We asked for a room at the rear of the hotel which was far quieter. The male staff on reception were all very helpful, the female staff rather less so. We were able to book for the Moulin Rouge through the hotel. It is expensive but it is a once in a lifetime experience. From Temple it is an easy one change trip to the Pigalle district.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Simple - Very Clean, Great Service, Good Location and Very Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lrgranot
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but just what we needed on a tour of five days in Paris. We arrived early afternoon (13:00). They received us with a smile, and offered us a cold drink. The room was ready within half an hour. We entered a small room, decorated and clean. Very comfortable bed, very clean shower and toilet. A very small balcony toward the main street. When the window porch is closed we do not hear anything from the street. Breakfast was rich and tasty. We bought tickets to Bus tour at the counter and they even checked for us a night cruise on the Seine. Very warm and courteous service. We strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN SMALL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SANDYSCOT
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights. We booked a twin room but when we arrived in the evening it was 2 twin beds made up as one double. As I was with a friend we didn't want to share a bed so went to reception to ask for a change. He wasn't helpful at all so we separated the beds ourselves and had to strip the bed to make 2 singles. Not good for senior citizens. Next day we asked another receptionist and he gave us more sheets but they don't have single sheets or covers so beware. The bed-mat was so heavy doubled up, it kept falling off the bed. We spoke to the manager who was most helpful and pleasant and he promised he would deal with out complaint. The twin/double rooms faced the front, which we wanted but the traffic was so noisy I couldn't have slept without earplugs. Small pleasant room and bathroom and French windows in both rooms. Breakfast room nice, modern and clean with usual Continental breakfast. Handy for Republique metro which is a main one and we got around the city fine. Cost and quality of food in restaurants appalling!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are right!!!”
Reviews.Author: simplyjo51
Reviews.Content: Booked through Airmiles, BA flight homebound was cancelled due to strike, but we booked free of charge for the following day. BA flight fantastic, even got free upgrade to Club, where we had lots of leg room and a lovely meal! Paris Blue Van shuttle from/to CDG airport and to/From hotel was on time, comfortable and quite affordable at E62 for 2 of us, recommend this service. Hotel lived up to all reviews! We found the staff really pleasant and helpful, the rooms are small but adequate. CH worked and French doors gave plenty of fresh air, but also a lot of traffic nose. Rue de Turbigo is a very road. Lift working but small. Yes sliding door to bathroom is frosted glass! Beds were so comfortable, twins as requested, small but usable bathroom. Decor clean and bright, TV has DVD platyer built in. Beds made every day and bathroom cleaned, cleal towels as well. Take travel kettle as one is not provided in the room. Well stocked Monoprix supermarket 5 min walk from Hotel. Breakfast room very modern and clean, staff very helpful. Breakfast is continental - cereals, tea, coffee, bread rolls, croissants, cheeses and jams. Bread for toast. Location - Open Top Tour bus stop 2 min walk at Republic, hotel very close to 3 metro's with Republic a few steps from hotel being the closest. We didn't use the metro due to mobility problems, and bought a 2 day ticket E32 each for the Open Top Bus, excellent way of getting to know Paris, with 4 interchangeable routs and an audio guide. Entrance to Notre Dame is free, but there are no audio guides on Sundays. The only down-side to Paris are the street beggars who ask if you are English. Replying in German just made them walk away!

Reviews.Title: “We will return without hesitation. C'est parfait !”
Reviews.Author: mofongo
Reviews.Content: We are thrilled to be staying in this little hotel. In fact, we just extended our stay from 5 to 7 nights. I believe Kamel (reception) took pity on us when we arrived. As soon as he saw my husband's size (6'8"), we were fortunate to be given their largest room--very good size by parisian standards, with a beautiful, bright bathroom.Excellent shower/temp/pressure.Plenty of storage. Bed (US double) is super comfy.Lovely view onto rue Turbigo.Previous comments about convenient location are spot on. Lobby is currently under renovation so there has been no real seating area there for several days, but that's a very small gripe. They are making progress so things should be completed shortly. Oh--did I mention free, reliable wifi ? We booked through the hotel's website a few months ago, and took advantage of an excellent rate for 3+ nights, breakfast included. Everyone on staff has gone out of their way to accommodate us in any way possible. We have already discussed coming back to this terrific little gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Butic hotel, excellent service, good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Liliana_lalea
Reviews.Content: I loved this littel hotel, the great services, the french breakfast (not much variety, but good and consistent), the receptionists (they provided us informations and/or offered to make us reservations, find more info on the internet, great dispon ibility)... We stayed for Christmas 2009 and we were treated very good. The rooms are small, but is a franch hotel, boutique style, so it is normal... The raport price/services wes excellent, more than I would expect, really. The 2 metro stops near by, one of them with about 5 or 6 lines... very important when you take Paris by foot... The restaurants, supermarket, even fast food were near... I especially loved the staf. Thank you for the great Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LIZINI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of Feb. I booked direct through their website but oddly they had no knowledge of the booking when we arrrived, but this was soon rectified. We went to the room, which was small, but I understand rooms are generally very small, but it was nicely decorated and clean. Had to ask for extra pillows and blankets as we found it got quite chilly at night. There is air-con but this just seemed to blow cold air around even though we set it to a warmer temp? The staff on reception are very helpful and give you a map of the area and show you where to go etc. Breakfast was really impressive - a selection of Kellogs cereals, toast, pastries and hot drinks and fruit juice. And the dining area is really modern and funky too. Only complaints I would have about this hotel was the chilliness at night (no central heating) and it was quite noisy at night from people flushing the toilets etc, but this was only a small problem. There was no noise from the street at night. Free Wi-Fi access at the hotel too. There is a metro station (Temple) literally 10 seconds from the hotel and there is a more main metro station (Repulique) about 2 mins walk away so easy eccess to everywhere in Paris. I would stay here again if I visit Paris again. Its a beautiful city, but quite a lot of Bosnian beggers - just speak French and they wont bother you. Also I would highly recommend travelling Eurostar too, far easier than travelling from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on - clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Masters_Cov
Reviews.Content: Just back from new years eve in paris and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights - it was perfect. For a 2 star i would say it was more like a 3 star by Paris standards, i.e. decent size rooms, clean, great location and extremely helpful and friendly staff who went out of their way to help. Dont expect the Ritz and you'll be fine - if you want convenience and good service at an affordable price - then definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: mdryden
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for two nights last weekend and were pleased with this hotel. We had twin room 53 which had a balcony and a spotless bathroom - fully equipped with bath, shower and hairdryer. The room wasn't huge but bigger than some I have had in Paris. The reception staff were all very friendly and the breakfast was fine. This hotel is not 5 star but neither was the price. Perfectly adequate and well situated. Temple metro station is just a few steps away and the big Republique station only a few minutes away. Recommend the Republique area for choice of restaurants - virtually everything one could want is on offer there. Also you must visit the Cafe du Temple just across the road just to experience the crazy decor - fabulous. Would return without hesitation......in fact we probably will!.

Reviews.Title: “A most friendly place I hope to stay at again, thanks Liinaa”
Reviews.Author: greggWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was perfect in location near the metro and Republique. Each receptionist spoke English with a smile and was very helpful with questions, directions or offering suggestions. Liinaa was really nice and when I realized I had not reserved enough nights and they were already booked for my last night in Paris she called around and got me another room a block away.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing - given the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: RoverTLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and thought it was fine - but wouldn't rate it any more highly than that, partly because of what seemed to be renovation work on the ground floor which doesn't give a great impression on arrival. Our twin room was on the 5th floor at the front with a balcony (a bonus) and the room was certainly clean, although there was a damp/drainy smell from the bathroom. The bathroom was also a little strange, unless you're happy to watch your room-mate on the loo; the glass door really does preclude privacy. Breakfast is a buffet of cereals, bread, cheese, croissants, eggs, jams etc. (but no fruit, other than a sweetened puree) and runs until a very civilised 10.30am. The hotel is in a great location with plenty of sights within walking distance and the Republique metro a very short stroll and staff were friendly. But given some of the great reviews, we'd expected something a bit special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: ESG2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband for one night for a weekend away in Paris. We wanted to stay in the Marais as we love the area. We got a great rate for this hotel and were very happy with it. It is not glamorous or beautiful as you would expect with the price. The bed was very comfortable (sheet, not quilt). The room as small - typical for Paris. The bathroom was new and nice. There was a lift. There is free wifi all over the hotel which is great bonus. We did not have breakfast as for ten euros you are better off going out to the many amazing cafes. The location is fantastic and close to the metro. If you want to spend more and have some glamour go elsewhere, but for the price in such a great area in Paris I would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alphamelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 7 September for two nights and couln't be more happier! A great hotel in a fabulous location, easy walking to all main attractions and the metro is right at your door step. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The guys at the front desk were very helpful with directions etc. and went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable. There is wireless connection throughout the hotel. I didn't have a computer with me and I was loaned a laptop by the front desk to access the internet in my room, a great bonus. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel and I look forward to returning to Paris and Relais du Marais. Australia

Reviews.Title: “cute and convenient”
Reviews.Author: blamanj
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small, it's Paris. The are well designed to make use of the space. Front desk staff was always helpful, and enthusiastically assisted us in our minimal French, but would happily switch to English if we needed it. Interiors are pretty and spotlessly clean. Only minor quibbles, we couldn't get any ice, and they don't have any laundry service. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ryan-kay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and 2 nights from the 21st til the 23rd of August and could not be happier with our stay. It's a perfect little hotel in a beautiful Paris street. The hotel was very nice inside and when we arrived at the hotel, which is only a short journey from CDG via bus & metro, the friendly hotel staff upgraded us to one of the best rooms. We had a fantastic top floor room with a modern spacious bathroom and a comfortable bed, TV and fridge. The views very perfect and at night we could see the Eiffel Tower lit up from our window. The sound of the traffic was expected but it does not make it hard to sleep at all. Breakfast was very reasonable with a choice of hot and cold food and drinks in a modern breakfast area with the option to eat outside in the covered terrace. The hotel is only a 30 second walk to the metro station (Temple) which takes you directly to the Opera station which then links you with the whole of the city. This makes it perfect to explore Paris in no time at all. We had a fantastic time and I could not thank the hotel staff enough for the wounderful time we both had and would definetly stay here in the future. We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Once again, thank you to all the staff at the Le Relais du Marais for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value”
Reviews.Author: foxy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, near the metro and in 10-15 minutes to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Beatrix01
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel for our weekend in Paris & will definitely book it again for our next visit. The hotel is quite small but very conveniently located near 3 metro stations and not a long walk away from Notre Dame or the Louvre. We had a nice room overlooking the road, but it was very quiet & very clean. The staff were also very helpful with our travelling plans. A great hotel & highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location,outstanding friendliness...”
Reviews.Author: Doecops05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a single room on the 2nd floor. The room (21) had no views and was a little claustrophobic although cleverly designed with a superb and modern shower room. No air conditioning but an overhead fan which cooled the room a little (used for heat when cold). There is a hairdryer in the showerroom which only works when the fan is switched on, and unfortunately only one accessible plug in the room. The small (queen size) double bed is very comfortable indeed and provides easy viewing of the wall mounted flat screen tv (all in French unfortunately - no CNN or BBC world service). The room is very functional and overall very clean although there is a distinct smell of smoke in this room on the linen and furnishings, unfortunately. It is pleasantly and artisically designed although a little OTT and would benefit from being Feng Shui'd (hanging lanterns over the bed) XD. Overall it is reasonably quiet although you can hear a distant and regular rumble of the metro. There is a small window in the bathroom with no view, and a small window to the side of the fire escape (no view) - lending itself to a slightly claustrophobic feel, but adequate overall. Pleasantly furnished and modern overall with good shower (although it wouldn't stay fixed when showering so you have to hold it - good power though and modern). A tiny lift will take your luggage up and they have a storage room for luggage on checkout day which is useful. I parked in a nearby road in a garage at 25 euros per day. Not cheap but expected in Paris. Traffic is pretty horrendous around this part of Paris as it is so central and there are one way streets off the République square so be warned if you are driving in. It takes approx 15 minutes average walking speed to get to Le Louvre, so a great base for sightseeing the delights of the beautiful city of Paris. An extremely friendly reception from all staff who also speak good English, would I stay here again? Yes, but only for 1 or 2 nights. Comfy bed, comfy pillows, clean and good shower room facilities. I didn't have breakfast because I have a special diet which the French breakfasts don't cater for. No fridge in room but good value for a 2 star hotel in the centre of Paris. Free internet access too - a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCraysPond
Reviews.Content: A great deal of attention has gone into the docor - a bit art deco - making this an attractive central base. The food was good and the staff very friendly and helpful. An excellent value for money hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: David4444
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very close to Republique & Temple Metro Stops. Front Staff was VERY FRIENDLY and helpful. Rooms were small, yet just what was expected in Paris. Breakfast could have been better... 10 Euros for basically Cereal, Yogurt, Crossoints & Coffee. Free WI-FI is a big PLUS! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “simple and great”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynDanNYC
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris for the weekend. Nothing fancy, but cheap, nice, close to everything and a very nice staff. Room was simple, but my 6th floor view was amazing. Walls were thin, but nothing major. Def would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yoonster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found it the perfect base for exploring Paris. The entire hotel oozes character and charm. The reception staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The lift is tiny, but the free wifi in room is a huge plus. We had a small room with a lovely view over Rue de Turbigo. Breakfast was fantastic, with a selection of croissants, bread, jam, cereal and tea/coffee. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for our trip to see Le Tour de France 2009”
Reviews.Author: Clooney007
Reviews.Content: My friends found this hotel on the web and it suited our needs very nicely indeed . A smart good value hotel within easy reach of the Pompidou centre and then on to the Batobus waterboat which takes you to all the key tourist spots in a pleasant and easy fashion. The service at reception was very friendly and most helpful in showing us on the maps how to get to our destinations whether it was a recommended restaurant ,a tube service or where is the best place to see Le Tour arrive on the Champs Elysees. As such we had a tremendous weekend in Paris , enjoyed Le Tour went to some wonderful restaurants and made some new friends. Thank you to the staff at this hotel you are fantastique ! Dr John Sheehan Cycling Fan Au Revoir

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Burybean
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 rooms at this hotel for my self/sisters mum and brother.....so hoped it would meet our needs.Need n,t have worried, Very helpful, clean, loads of hot water for baths/showers and very nice continental breakfast that would put some four star hotels to shame! Only downfall, you could here the traffic, (you would here this at most other hotels in paris)and no bar. That didn,t matter, we met up accross the road at another before going out. 24 hour reception was great when we arrived back drunk!! Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Ideal Hotel for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: Penshulins
Reviews.Content: Le Relais du Marais has everything that the visitor to Paris requires!! Clean comfortable bedrooms, friendly helpful staff and an excellent breakfast service. The proximity to the Metro is an added bonus, We can recommend this hotel without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel had everthing we needed”
Reviews.Author: pjvmersey
Reviews.Content: Took advice from other trippers and stayed at the the Relais.Great location. rooms fine for short stay, very comfortable, close to metro, breakfast excellent, friendly staff, perfect for a short city break. Does anyone know of a similar hotel in Barcelona?

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: murphysmum77
Reviews.Content: Contrary to alot of guests who have rated this hotel we were put in one of the back rooms, all we could see from the old wooden framed window ( not double glazed) were walls and cockroach traps. If one of us needed to get from one side of the room to the other ,the other one had to get on the bed to clear the way. The toilet seat and hairdryer were broken. The corridors were painted in a nicotene yellow which added to the depressive feeling you felt everytime you went back to the hotel, so was the inside of the first room they put us in. They told us the rooms that were not refurbished were what you paid for if you went on airmiles rate. The dining room staff made no attempt to communicate with you even if you tried your best and most polite french. they were very different if a french person came in and particularly ignorant towards the English ( as were alot of Parisiens), the croissants were nice for breakfast but tea, coffee and hard boiled eggs were cold, and the french bread was so hard it could be used as a truncheon. Don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, basic, but close to metro so good for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Cappyjuju
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais du Marais for 2 nights in June. We paid 125 Euros per night. The room was really small – but that was to be expected. The bathroom was weird – felt like we were staring at each other going to the bathroom. The daytime clerk was nice and informative, the nighttime clerk was nice but just didn’t seem to get it. (Bed was really uncomfortable and when I asked for another pillow, I was given a couch throw pillow in a pillow case which didn’t help much.) We had a few issues with the Wi-Fi – had to switch signals a few times but it worked out. It is a 2 minute walk to the Metro and there are 2 other lines within 10 minutes so getting around the city is easy. Close to ATMs and a couple of late night places to eat. I’ve stayed in much nicer hotels for cheaper in cities in the US, but it was our first time to Paris and we hear hotels are expensive so perhaps this was decent deal. (I would liken this quality of hotel to a Days Inn or Drury pre-remodel in the US- something that we’d pay $75USD a night for)

Reviews.Title: “perfectly suited my needs”
Reviews.Author: PokingAbout
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights at this small hotel in June. It is perfectly located less than 100 metres from a small metro stop and only about 300 metres from a much larger one, with a direct bus to the Pont Neuf directly across the road, making getting around the city very easy indeed. Rooms smallish but very clean, with all windows double-glazed to insulate against noise from the busy street outside. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Good breakfast room but I did not eat there, choosing to stroll outside for food when I needed it - lots of small shops nearby. Free WiFi in room, which was very handy. All in all, a good choice at around 100 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: helenwright22
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with 2 metro stations nearby. Rooms and elevator are small but we didn't spend much time in the hotel to really care. Breakfast each morning was excellent and filled you right up until lunch time. Staff were very helpful and very friendly. Would definetly recommend and would stay there again! This hotel should be at least 3*

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: strakur74
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the positive reviews on this site. That the room is extremely small does not come as a surprise. Standard of cleanliness is OK for a two-star hotel, but just OK. The WiFi-signal is weak on floor 2 and 3. The location is good both for walking and the Métro (and buses, which I prefer and an excellent route-planer is available at http://ratp.fr). A good supermarket (Monoprix) is just behind the hotel. No really good restaurants on this part of rue de Turbigo, but many are to be found on the next street, rue du Vertbois. The description of the hotel on the different websites is ambiguous and may give the impression that breakfast is included; at check-in I was also told where and when breakfast was served but was not averted to the fact that it would cost 10€ per person/day — well, no lies told but certainly not the whole truth. I would have chosen to take my breakfast elsewhere ahd I known. So ask whether breakfast is included and have a look at the "buffet" before deciding whether to take the breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel at a great spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mlescape
Reviews.Content: The hotel enjoys a very good location. The hotel staff is very friendly and they can provide first aid or any info. Very good indeed - a bit overpriced for small rooms but perfectly clean and tasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb for our short stay in Paris, excellent staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: srananlobi
Reviews.Content: We were in a big group (10) and we had a great time, the location was great and best of all the staff was very very friendly! From the person cleaning the room to the person serving breakfast. Last but not least, special mention to the Receptionist Liinaa who made extra effort in helping us getting the reservations we wanted and made the wknd complete! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back here”
Reviews.Author: Monobasis
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here all of the three times we've run away to Paris. Everyone else has really said everything; I just wanted to add my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Stella_B1
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at this hotel while attending culinary school. This small, friendly hotel is well located in the third arrondisement near the Place de la Republique. There are two metro stops nearby that quickly connect you to the rest of the city. The staff is very friendly, especially Hakim and Amirouche who went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.
