There is a nice breakfast room which serves continental breakfast along with boiled eggs. The rooms are all in the process of being remodeled and upgraded. The styles vary and can be a little over the top, but everything is comfortable and kept VERY clean. Like many hotels in large cities, the rooms on the front of the building can be noisy. My room was on the back and was quite quiet. This district is a great place to wander and shop. The 3rd arrondisement has some lovely shops and restaurants. The Rue de Bretagne was one of my favorites and only about a 10 minute walk away. I will definitely return to Paris and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: birdlondon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my boyfriend for a long weekend and I found this hotel was perfect for just that. Our room was small but spotless, likewise with the en suite. We did not eat there, as there were boulangeries situated not far from the hotel. Location is ideal as this is just beside Temple metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel at a low cost”
Reviews.Author: crookers
Reviews.Content: The hotel owner were very nice and teh rooms were cozy. Great breakfast and overall really nice staff. i really recommend this hotel if your'e going paris. close to the subway station Temple.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: NYC1
Reviews.Content: Tiny but clean room, VERY comfortable bed, friendly reception, good strong shower. Neighborhood is noisy but very convenient. Not a place to get comfortable and relax, and not a lot of charm, but if you are not spending much time in the room it's fine for the price. Might want to bring or buy earplugs if you are sensitive to street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sez1842
Reviews.Content: Hotel is handy for everything without being right in tourist central. Some lovely restaurants nearby we recommend arts et metiers. Just about everything is within walking distance but the metro is right next door which means you can get anywhere if you dont want to walk. Breakfast was great everyday, filled you up for the day ahead. Very friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again. Room was a little small but if you're in Paris how much time are you going to be spending in your hotel?!

Reviews.Title: “A riskfree stay”
Reviews.Author: Wulff1
Reviews.Content: We got what we payd for. A nice hotell with a staff that really wants you feel well during your stay. The rooms are small, but was shined every day by the staff, and thats whats important. Of course are there better hotels in the city, I presume, but then you have to spend more of your money on it. Positive: Supermarked and the metro next door. A cheep familydriven italian restaurant named Chez Renato 5 minutes from the hotel (ask the reseption, superb and cheep pasta). Negative: Nothing, except the size of the room. So you really get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: javedakshar
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just spent a wonderfull weekend at Le Relais du Marais. The hotel is well located in the centre of Paris and close to the metro station. We were welcomed with a smile and were told that our room was ready , so we checked in straight away. The room was simply gorgoeus. It was clean, refurbished, nicely decorated and we had a small balcony and a flat screen TV. We also got a bath as requested and new towels were provided everyday . Breakfast was as we had expected, delicious with hot croissants and other good selection. We would like to thank the entire staff who took good care of us, and especially a lovely lady, Lina, who helped us so much with directions, sightseeing information, diner reservations and organised our transfer to the airport, saved us so much time and made our short-term holiday a nice one. We will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends ,and stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and clean no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Northerner099
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night city break in Paris. The hotel was in a really good location with a one minute walk to the nearest Metro station. The hotel was basic and clean,but has eveything you need .The staff were very friendly , and we recommend you have a espresso in the lobby ! Paris is a beautiful city and 4 nights was just right to see it all on foot , with a little help from the Metro ...All the sights and the food are reasonably priced but the drinks are very expensive. Over all we had a brilliant time and i would definitely recommend this hotel to others .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff / perfect location .”
Reviews.Author: jooles70
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris & really enjoyed our stay at Le Relais . The staff are lovely and very helpful . We stayed 3 nights & where given clean bedding & towels everyday . The only downside is that our room was very small , my husband couldn't stand to use the loo as there wasn't enough space !!! But when we looked in other rooms , they all looked massive ! Loads of breakfast , tea coffee pastries yoghourt juices eggs etc etc . Perfect location , 2 minutes walk from Republic which metro leads to everywhere . Will return !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with reservations”
Reviews.Author: TigersfanHampshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excelletly situated, with a good variety of restaurants nearby, at all prices. The ones in The Boulevard du Temple are a good example. Also close to a large Monoprix for supermarket shopping. The hotel itself is good value for money. I was travelling alone, so my room was a single. The size was perfectly adequate. The bathroom was immaculate with an amazingly powerful shower. The hotel staff maintained the spotlessness of the accommodation throughout my stay. Breakfast is extremely good value, especially when compared to the 'Formules' in cafes close by. If all you need, however, is ONE cup of coffee and a cake/croissant , then use a cafe- it will be cheaper. I only have a couple of reservations about my stay ; my room was on the second floor at the rear. Unfortunately, Temple Metro station is very close to the hotel, and I could hear the trains rumbling through about every ten minutes. To be fair, this never disturbed my sleep - once I had worked out what the rumbling was, and it was only really noticeable when things were very quiet. Rooms on higher floors might not experience this noise at all. My second reservation would be the thickness of the doors. Early morning could be very noisy when other guests were locking/unlocking their rooms. On the whole though, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Find!!”
Reviews.Author: heilan_coo03
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - right next to main metro lines, but you can easily walk to the centre of town or to the Seine/Eiffel Tower in under half an hour. Surrounded by places to eat - everything from multinational burger joints to Parisian bars. Room comfortable (and very clean) and ideal for a couple. Lift a little bit snug, but there are stairs!! Breakfast is a little bit pricey, but not mandatory. It is, however, all you can eat, so get your money's worth. But more than anything, the staff are FANTASTIC - nothing was too much trouble; Well done them. Have stayed in many hotels in Paris- and can hugely recommend this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cornishsnapper
Reviews.Content: This little hotel near to the Place de la Republique is ideal in every way. It is close enough to the city centre to be walkable, but far enough to get away from all the crowds. Situated near three Mertro lines it's ideally placed for exploring this fabulous city. There are numerous eating establishments nearby, but we'd recommend three - L'Absinthe about 300 metres away is friendly and reasonable; Au Fil des Saisons about 100 metres away is divine - small and with superb food; Le Royale Couscous just of Republique serves delicious North African food. However the hotel itself is the star - the staff are really friendly (something you don't always find in Parisian hotels!) and nothing is too much trouble. Our room was amazing with the most stunning coloured glass brick wall built into the room - it has to be seen to be believed. Everything was spotless and the room was very well serviced every day. The dining room is a real delight to the eye being very colourful and funky. Breakfasts were everything you could wish with endless coffee, croissants, juices. Fill up for the whole morning's exploring! This is the second time we've visited the Relais and we couldn't recommend it more highly - a real gem

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice, with a just few issues”
Reviews.Author: Marc R
Reviews.Content: The appearance of our room was delightful with its thoughtful color schemes and textures. Although extremely small, we had a grand balcony with terrific views to enjoy; the balcony ran the width of our room, including the bathroom. There were many elements effectively placed into the small space including bed-side tables, a closet, a desk, a TV, a full sized bed, various lighting fixtures, etc. Although we expected a hard to operate (for US people) European-style bathroom, this one had its own special dysfunctional issues. First, there was a chic wall shelf over the sink that contained the mirror, lighting and several shelves to put your items. However, when you would bend over to splash your face with water, your forehead would hit the shelving. Hopefully, this is not the design in all rooms. Second, the shower didn’t have a curtain but a folding glass shield that was supposed to keep the water from hitting the floor. Needless to say, it didn’t do that at all and we had a good flood after each washing. We then needed to use half of your towels to soak up the water to avoid a slippery hazard. Those issues aside, there is a very cute breakfast room on the second floor that kept us very satisfied and allowed us to meet some other folks staying at the hotel. There is also a pleasing covered porch off this room, but with the freezing weather in November, we stayed in. PS: Be sure to close the heavy drapes when moving around the room nude or in scant clothing… the privacy curtains do not work… we found out the hard way….

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: bigbambi
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at the hotel to see in Paris over the New Years. The location was perfect with good access to the metro, la Marais and other local amenities. The room was very clean, flat screen TV, our own balcony with ensuite. The staff were very friendly and they certainly made the stay very enjoyable. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard each day. The breakfast included in the price was fine, nothing too fancy but as Paris is so expensive (with the £ & Euro being equal) it was a great opportunity to fill ourselves up! We would return again to the hotel and we would certainly recommend it. Bonne année!

Reviews.Title: “An ideal spot and friendly hosts at the hotel le Relais du Marais”
Reviews.Author: Eurooppalainen
Reviews.Content: As I travelled for a 4 days holiday trip to Paris with my daughter of 8 years I looked for a small, proper and a peacefull hotel with an easy access by metro to the Roissy air port and to different parts in Paris. From the hotel reviews I expected the rooms to be small (unfortunately no way to accommodate a family of 4 members!) and some noise could be heard from the neighbouring rooms (My daughter slept well but I used ear plugs during some hours), which showed to be true... but so did the positive comments as well! The personnel were extremely nice and liked children, the rooms were very clean, the area quite safe, the breakfast tasty (but expensive if not included with the price of the room, not reallly "continental") and, thanks to 2 different metro stations nearby, there was an very easy access to the city all around. Within the walking distance there are lots of nice boutiques, bakeries and cafés of the Marais (lexcellent galettes bretonnes and crepes at the Breizh Café, rue Vieille du Temple!). And Monoprix and Tati stores around the corner. Some tips to those travelling with kids in winter: it is worth visiting the Cirque d'hiver (15 minutes by foot, at the rue Amelot) the Christmas market in Champs Elysees plus the lights and the windows of the great department stores (Galerie Lafayettes, Printemps).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience...”
Reviews.Author: wanderl_st
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel after reading positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I would say the experience of staying was a mix of both good, so-so and bad points as follows: The good: as mentioned in previous reviews the staff are very friendly and very helpful. Comfortable beds and pillows. Great shower pressure. Flat screen TV. Close location to metro (Temple/Republic). The so-so: small room size (to be expected in Paris). Average breakfast (but included in room rate so not too much to complain about). Small bathroom and see through door! Small bedsize (double not queen so quite cozy for two tall people). The bad: the room noise! We had a front facing room (4th floor) with balcony and the traffic noise outside was unbearable as Rue de Turbigo is a through road from Republique. There was also considerable noise from the hallway due to other guests talking and coming/going + early morning cleaning by staff. Despite other reviews claiming double glazing, it wasn't our experience and we had to shift rooms due to a very sleepless night. The second room we had was better, but thin walls still meant that other guests were audible. Overall, I would say the the noise outweighed other benefits about the hotel and probably wouldn't stay again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Warm staff and lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AquaBeenie
Reviews.Content: The staff there including receptionists and cleaning staff was all very kind and warm. Espeacially Liinaa kindly gave us a detailed information about our questions. Thanks a mil!! Although our room was a little small, the bathroom was cute and the breakfast area was so fabulous!! Bread was incredibly delicious, too!! We could walk to the 2 Metoro stations - Temple and Republique - freely so it was very useful. The supermarket Monoprix was just in front of the hotel so it was convenient. Joyeux Noel, Aco Masuda

Reviews.Title: “Good location and cheap”
Reviews.Author: sgkhoo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's trip to Paris and enjoyed a lovely stay at this hotel. The location is very convenient with the Temple Metro literally a few paces from the front door of the hotel, and Republique station just up the road. The hotel room itself was quite small but more than adequate for a two star hotel. We had a room on the sixth floor which faced the main road. It can be quite noisy with the window open so I'd suggest a room on the upper floors. The lift is tiny, but very quaint! The biggest pull of this hotel is the staff, who were all very warm, welcoming, and charmingly friendly. We attempted our meagre French when speaking to them, and they all reverted to fluent English straight away when they noted we were struggling. They are certainly the biggest assets to the hotel. Location-wise, the walk into town is not as far as it appears on the map. A leisurely stroll gets you to the George Pompidou centre in no time, and before you know it, you've arrived at Notre Dame!! There are also plenty of Velib cycle renting stalls nearby so if you feel energetic, there's an option as well! Finally, breakfast was included as part of our stay. I wouldn't pay a tenner for it though had it not been included.

Reviews.Title: “Le Relais du Marais is a great spot.”
Reviews.Author: NunesBrasil
Reviews.Content: In my recent trip to Paris, I stayed at Hôtel le Relais du Marais for five nights and thoroughly enjoyed my accommodation. The hotel is clean and they change the towels and make bed daily. The location of the hotel is great, just 2 minutes walk from two metro station. The staff is most helpful and very friendly, happy to take the time to provide maps, directions, and advice on how to get where. It proved to be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: star7474
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, breakfast was included when i booked through Turquiose Tours. The staff were very helpful and friendly, they give you a map on arrival, speak brilliant english, and also have a lugguge room if needed on departure. There are two metro stops very near by, we mainly used the Arts et Metiers metro station - i think looking back now it would be worth getting a metro pass if you are staying in Paris for a few days rather than searching for change all the time for the machines as they dont accept notes unless you queue up at the window. There is also a Mont Mart around the back of the hotel to pick up groceries and toiletries if needed. I stayed in a twin room on the third floor in a very contempory room, the room was clean and tidy and sufficient for 2 people, also having control over your heating was a nice feature. There are a few downsides only minor such as the bathroom door is a frosted glass panel decorated with marbles which is quite funky but when travelling with a friend, you can see them on the loo but you can just look away as there is a flat screen telly to watch with a couple of english speaking channels, you can also hear the toilet flush in other rooms and taps running but you dont hear people talking but im sure this is the case in many hotels. There is no tea making facilities in the room so i would bring a little travel kettle wih me next time. I will definately be returning to this hotel and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sistereurope
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Relais du Marais for 3 nights. My room was perfectly adequate for one, and the bathroom was really big by Paris hotel standards. My room was spotless, the bathroom was very clean - no complaints about the room. It was truly a value for the price. Most importantly, the staff couldn't have been nicer. Very friendly and helpful!!! The location is great - 2 metro lines within viewing distance of the front door, including the Place de Republique. All in all a wonderful stay and a true bargain for Paris. I'd stay there again for sure and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: gnilwod19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Relais for 3 nights with my wife, after having previously stayed there on a trip to Paris with my daughter in April. On the first occasion we had a very small room on the fourth floor, but nevertheless it was clean and we enjoyed the stay enough to rebook for the later visit. On this occasion I asked for and got a much bigger room on the sixth floor. As has been mentioned in other reviews, the hotel has a great location to explore Paris. It is right near Temple Metro Station and no more than 3 minutes walk to Republique, which is a main junction line. So within a few minutes on the underground, you can be at The Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Moulin Rouge or any of the other fantastic sights. The staff are always friendly and willing to assist with any request or help with handy local advice. We couldn't fault them. The breakfast was good, but at 10 euro each, unless it is included in your room rate, you might do better to grab a croissant & coffee at the bakery nearby, which was delicious. We had breakfast there once though, just to experience the cute, quirky breakfast room which we loved. In addition to being handy to the trains, there are plenty of places to eat in the area, especially around the Place de Republique. All in all, for the price, and considering the location, we thought that the Relais du Marais was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: TLTrish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais du Marais for a total of 6 nights in September over 2 stays. The location was great - very handy to 2 metro stations, but also good just to walk out from. Both rooms we stayed in were charming - one up on the 6th floor particularly so. Best of all the front desk staff were exceptionally helpful. When we arrived to check in the second time it felt like coming home. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY ENJOYED OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: windrushCornwall
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was a bit disappointed with our room but only because I had seen photos of other rooms by other trip advisors. Our room was small, dated with marks on the walls and paint peeling off the walls.. The corridor was also very smoky. However as this was a 2 star hotel and we were not planning on spending too much time in our room anyway we were not worried. I must say however that the room was very clean, the bedding was spotless as was the bathroom and there was always plenty of hot water. The bed was comfy and we always had a good nights sleep. We also had a small balcony but unfortunately this only looked onto another building. The breakfast was fine as we were only there for 4 nights - yogurt/puree fruit,cheese,croissants,bread rolls,eggs and cereal. The situation of the hotel was brilliant as it was so close to 2 Metro stations, the area had a nice buzz to it with plenty of eating places and was within walking distance to most parts of the city. Would I stay here again?Absolutely - but I hope to get a more funky room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: It is a toss-up to say which is the best thing about this hotel: the location or the friendliness and helpfulness of the front desk staff. The hotel is just 100 meters from the Republique Metro - a major hub for Paris, and a 15 minute walk through the Marais district to the right bank of the Seine or to the Bastille or Les Halles. It is in a lively area with plenty of good restaurants. The staff was great. I stayed on 2 discontiguous nights. The first night I was in 32 on the 3rd floor. Very nice room, excellent firm bed, flat screen TV, small wardrobe, big shower in a compact bathroom. The windows were double-glazed, so there is very little street noise. The second night, I was in 22, a bit smaller, but quite acceptable with the same good firm bed. I noted that the beds were true double sized, not queen sized (a queen is the same size as 2 twins). So if you are a big person or couple, this will be tight. All the rooms seem to have unique and cheerful painting schemes. The only negative I have about the hotel is that the walls are pretty thin. But given the price, location, and staff, and the fact that I am a sound sleeper, I was content.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Maryberry47
Reviews.Content: My husband and i chose this hotel after reading lots of reviews about it on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful to us. Our room wasnt very big , but efficient. We requested a balcony (smokers!), the views were brilliant. They were of the main street at the front of the hotel. The bathroom was very clean and lots of clean towels , soap , toilet roll. Our bed sheets were changed very day. (These things may seem like someting that is expected, but from reading LOTS of reviews for different hotels in paris, not all of them even provided the basics). The breakfast was coffee, cereal, crossiants , bread rolls, fruit, eggs, orange juice. It was perfectly fine. it was included with our hotel deal (alpha rooms.com). The location was good. We walked to the seine on the first day and it took us 20 mins. There are good restaurants in the republique area. Paris is expensive, so dont come thinking you wont spend a fortune, because you probably will. Average meal for two is aprox 50 euros. But if you go the latin quarter beside notre dame, there is alot of choice and cheaper about 30. EXTRA INFORMATION - ( which you may find useful, i know i would have!) We flew into CDG. We took RER B train to La Gard du Nord station and then Metro line 5 to the Republique Station. the hotel was a 5 minute walk away. We bought a paris viste pass (47 euro each) expensive enough, but that takes you to and from the airport, and around all the city as many times as you want. you will need transport for some of the attactions. there are different options though. check out: http://parisbytrain.com/charles-de-gaulle-airport-cdg-to-paris-by-train/

Reviews.Title: “Small and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: travelhobbit
Reviews.Content: The hotel had an excellent location, a stone's throw from one of Paris's metro stations and a long (but not too straining) walk from some of the city's major attractions, including the ile de la cite and the place des vosges. The rooms that me and my relatives stayed in, as well as being spotlessly clean, were individualised with their own colour schemes and quirky features (nifty bathroom doors and peacock feather cushions in mine) and the balcony view was a complete stunner of the Place de la Republique. Although, if I'm being picky, the smell of cigarette smoke was, on occassions, a bit too pervasive for my liking. The breakfast buffet was pretty good but could nonetheless have done with a little more variety in terms of food offered (eggs only patchily available). But nonetheless, the little breakfast room was splendidly decorated, cheerful and pleasant. Staff always friendly and accomodating, many with good English for those of us with patchy French. A perfect embellishment on a lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaSurrey
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend through Airmiles with my daughter and son for a bit of sightseeing. We stayed three nights and was delighted with the hotel. It was so clean and comfortable that it made our stay an extremely pleasant one. The staff couldn't do enough, the location was great, very safe and central to all the locations we wanted to go to. I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: KevSyd
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 days at the hotel and like other reviews I found the staff exceptionally friendly and very helpful..nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel is right next to Temple station and 3min walk from Republic metro, so you can get everywhere in Paris . There are lots of shops, cafes, a supermarket and great bakery only a street away. 10min walk is the main Maris area with all the sidewalk cafes and bars. The hotel was very modern and clean with a trendy breakfast room which has an outside balcony. I had a top floor room (ok size for one but maybe a bit small for two...but on par with other hotels in Paris) with a window overlooking the street and it was great to look out over Paris and watch all the happenings in the street below. The lift is very tiny and slow moving. The breakfast was ok but for 10euro its worth trying one of the outdoor cafes. I can highly recommend this hotel and will be staying there again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “It was GREAT to be back”
Reviews.Author: Arthur_Holland
Reviews.Content: Last year I visited Paris and stayed in this hotel. I enjoyed my stay so much I came back hoping to get a similar welcome. If possible I would say it was even better!!! I loveed staying at Le Relais du Marais. Thank you all staff. The room was not big but all I do there is sleep... Why pay more for space you don't need? Clean & tidy room & bathroom. By the way, ask the reception for good places to eat. Great recommendations!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: TheFrenchMayor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights the weekend of 18 July. We were delighted. Compared to other 2 stars hotel in Paris, this one is worth a very good 3 stars at least. Refurbishment of the common areas was completed in March and the rooms only 3 weeks ago. Rooms are tastefully decorated. Yes the rooms are small, but who spend their weekend in their room? We liked the light going on/off automatically in the corridors as you walk. Really like the outdoor patio of the breakfast room, especially when you escape the London rain and find yourself sitting outside enjoying the gorgeous croissant and pain au chocolat. The staff are well trained and are courteous and helpful: they do make this hotel a special place. The hotel location is great. you are within 15mn off all the main sites: Champs Elysées, Pont de l'Alma and its delightful Bateaux-Mouche, Eiffel Tower, Montmartre, etc. Will definitely stay there should we need a hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ls198725
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely ... it was in the perfect location as it was not too far out but also not in a very busy area. There are 2 metro stations very close. If you go to the repubique station you can get the metro to most attractions you wish to see. The staff in the hotel were fantastic very friendly and go out of your way to help! The rooms are cleaned daily and fresh towels and bed linen is put in. The view out of the windows is lovely ... nice to see the classic french buildings. And if you are staying in a room at the front of the building ... look out to the left of your window at night ... can see the top of the eiffel tower! Those who arent staying bed and breakfast there is a supermarket around the corner which does great pastries. There are lots of restaurants quite close by, if you walk up the street to the first junction and then left there are some great places, if you keep going you will come to Notre Dame. Only down side is they like you to leave the key with them ... though we did not have any problems with this.All in all this hotel was just what we wanted, had the perfect 21st birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel which makes an effort”
Reviews.Author: elizadolittle2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Relais du Marais for 4 nights by myself (I'm a 20 something female). Room was small - would have felt more so with 2 people and larger luggage but for me was fine - my little case fitted in the wardrobe - but perfectly formed. I had a lovely view across the street and was on the 4th floor. Double glazing must have been good as noise didn't disturb my sleep at all (though city noise tends not to bother me). I was there midweek and pretty sure nobody was in the adjoining room so no problems there - though if I'd had inconsiderate neighbours there may have been an issue. Room was spotlessly cleaned every day. Breakfast room has cool decor and food was perfectly nice. All staff were really friendly. I speak French but I heard them speak good English to other guests. I knew Paris well already (having lived there before) and have absolutely no problem with the area. Ignore the review about not taking lines 3 and 11 at night - I'd take care anywhere in a big city at night but these lines are fine. I'd recommend it to anyone who's on a budget but still wants to stay somewhere very decent. I booked through Turquoise Tours online - one night free!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: auscam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Room recently renovated, both room and bathroom spotless and cleaners did a great job every day. The breakfast was great - cereals, tea/coffe, fresh croissants, yoghurt, cheeses, bread, etc. Staff at the desk were always friendly and very helpful. Less than two minutes walk to a metro station and a few minutes to MonoPrix a large supermarket. The only downside is the room was small...but then a lot are in Europe. For the price it is a great hotel and I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Gunnsi
Reviews.Content: Few days ago me and my wife went to Paris for the weekend, i.e. thursday to sunday. Paris was great! and the friendly staff at the hotel was a part of it. At arrival, late on thursday evening, we weren't sure if the breakfast was included so we asked and was told that it was. But it wasn't!, the man in the reception probably misread it. At checkout we were then told that it was NOT included BUT we didn't have to pay for it anyway. Sometimes when people make mistakes like theese they tend to get a bit arrogant but the lady in the reception was just more kind then ever. Leaving you with happy thoughts in stead of making you feel guilt. As in many hotels in Paris, the corridors are small and the elevator only for 3 persons max (or one guy from Texas). Everything was clean, no bugs, everything just shiny. The WiFi Internet access worked fine. Bathroom shiny and plenty of water from the shower. Comfortable bed and extra blankets in the closet for colder nights. Air conditioning loudless and good. Overall just a nice pleasent stay. I will defenitely use this hotel again on my next visit. Kind regards, Gunnar Þór, Iceland.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2 star hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Gareth66
Reviews.Content: I booked this nice hotel through Airmiles ( flight too). It is a very nice hotel. My room was recently refurbished in a modern way, with warm terracotta themed curtains and furnishings. It was very cheerful and pleasant to sleep in. th bathroom is sufficient and very modern. The water pressure excellent, and the bath fills up a treat! The hotel is seconds from the Temple metro stop, which makes it very easy to get around. La Republique ( the place and the Metro stop) is just up the road a few minutes away, and that metro is a main hub. Get a Paris visite card from the Metro machines, it's easy and cheaper that way. 1,3,5 day cards available. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Lots of tourist brochures, and it has a nice breakfast bar. It does cost a fair bit to eat there, but it is nice food. There are lots of cheaper places to eat around the area by the way. So why not vary each day, but show a little loyalty to the hotel too! There is a Monoprix supermarket just around the corner from the hotel. It's Tesco prices not Netto though. But who cares, the food on sale is french and excellent! There are no irons or ironing boards available, or room safe ( mine didn't have one) or tea making facilities, or minibar. But this is a top end 2 star, and believe me it's a good hotel to sleep in, and it's got good insulation with double glazed windows. I didn't get to grips with the air conditioning. There were no unneccessary swipes of my credit card, no little extras charged which i hadn't used, all very top notch customer services. The staff were kind and courteous, and very decent. I will be using this hotel again as a base to explore Paris. I felt comfortable and relaxed there. As i did in Paris as a whole, Paris is quite laid back, that surprised me for a capital city. But Paris is so used to tourists and seems to accept them, but be warned. Relax there, leave the drama-queen traveller mindset at home, just shrug the shoulders if things don't go your way, be patient and I think the French will accept you all the more! There is little point getting all hot and bothered about things.Chill out, relax and amble your way around Paris whether it's shopping, or Museum stalking, or just walking. And if a problem arises, just take a deep breath, smile, and it will be resolved all the quicker. C'est possible!Tee hee!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: campbell88
Reviews.Content: We booked here because we were obliged to spend a night in an airmiles hotel and this was the cheapest near le Marais. It was easy to get to and convenient if you are planning to travel by the metro but wasn't really in le Marias - a 10 minute walk away in fact. However it was clean, the room was an okay size and it had a (small) bath. Make sure you feel comfortable with your travelling companion if you are sharing a room as there is a (slightly opaque) glass sliding door which does little to protect your modesty when using the toilet in a confined space! The best thing about the hotel were the staff on reception. They were very helpful and friendly and made all the difference to our stay. The breakfast was fine too- served in a light bright breakfast room on the first floor. We had a choice of bread, crossaints, fruit, jam, coffee, cereals, cheese, yoghurts etc and it was available from 7.30 - 10.30 which was great. As in the title..just fine...

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean in convienient area, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nightguest
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in a single room, midweek. Hotel was easy to find, 2 metro stations very close Temple and Republique. Also easy and close walking to the river and sights. Foodplaces (incl McD), supermarkets and clothing shops around the corner. Safe area. The hotel itself is charming and exactly how you imagine a Paris hotel. Small lobby, small lift but none of these things bother me. Excellent staff, very helpful and friendly, always asking if everything is ok :) They speak english as well. Room was very clean, mine was with no view (only rooftops) and towards the back of the hotel. I would imagine the front side to be a bit noisier. City noise has never bothered me, but if you are a light sleeper you might need earplugs. There is noise between the rooms though, but I expected that. Comfortable bed, great shower!, thick towels and again very clean (I am fuzzy about these things) I never had the breakfast so can't comment on it. Overall, a lovely hotel with a very personal touch and I will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: missy_tassles
Reviews.Content: We're a couple in our 30s who stayed for 7 nights for our anniversary - this hotel was easy to find, the staff were really helpful, friendly and polite, replied to us in French when we tried it out, but were also fine in English if asked. The room, had everything we needed - modern, spotless, a double bed, stool and desk, wth a little bathroom with sink, toilet and shower (although there are baths in some rooms if you request). The best thing was we were on the 5th floor and had a marvellous balcony view too! The lift is charmingly petite also! The buffet breakfast was well-stocked, but if it's a little steep at 10 euros, there's a large supermarche just round the corner, or a boulangerie and many other cafes, almost literally on the doorstep! Especially ideal for travelling around on foot or on the metro - very central, easy to get to from anywhere in the central zones, and only a few minutes walk from the Pompidou centre, and only 5 or 10 mins from the river. Felt perfectly fine and safe wandering at night round here also.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back there!”
Reviews.Author: Mel L
Reviews.Content: In reading all the reviews on this hotel, it is important to remember it is a 2/3 star hotel and not a 5 star. But having said that, in many respects it was better than a 5 star. For example, the way you are treated by the staff makes you feel like you are the only guest there - they always had the time to chat, help and smile. We had room 34 overlooking the road at the front. Yes, of course the traffic was noisy, is this not the centre of a major city? But the double glazing was excellent and could shut out all the noise if it was necessary. The room was not huge, but quite adequate for our short stay. It was clean and functional, and the big double bed was firm and very comfortable. The bath/shower room was fresh and clean, if a little small. And oh boy, what a breakfast they serve up! No, not an English breakfast, something much better. Healthy, energy food and lots of it! If you are looking for a clean and friendly good-value 2/3 star hotel in central Paris, look no further. We will definitely go there again - even if I could afford to go to a 5 star! Finally, forget the review about the rooms that are near to the lift and effected by its noise, there is no noise. Mel & Carole Lacey, Norwich, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Exit3DC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a double room and our cousin stayed next door in a single room. We were all very pleased with the rooms. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Also, the hotel staff were wonderful and friendly. When I tried my poor french out, he didn't wince and even continued speaking in french to me--most of the french will just respond to you in english as soon as they hear a horrible accent like mine. But don't worry, the staff speaks excellent english too and were always friendly and helpful. Also, we noticed this across several shifts--everyone was great! The location is also very nice for getting around to all the sights. Will def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Chesterginge
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel very late at night, and were greeted by a very helpful staff member who outlined exactly the best place to go for late night meals. All of the front desk staff at this hotel were friendly and courteous. The location is great, we walked from the hotel to the Pompidou centre, Notre damme, Louvre and back again, and we had no problems. the area directly around the hotel is relatively cheap compared to the rest of Paris ( I.e., still very expensive) and we found some truly great places to eat and drink. We booked the hotel through turquoise tours, and I would highly recommend them as it was so much cheaper and completely hassle free when we arrived. We got a 3 nights for 2 deal which really was so cheap. The room we had was small, but exactly as we expected. the shower was brilliant, better than our one at home!! You can hear a lot of goings in in the hotel, particularly as the room adjacent door was literally right next door to ours. But we knew that this would be the case, and for the price we really didn't mind. The bed was comfortable enough, and although the view wasn't good at all we hadn't planned on staying in the room much anyway! As we were out drinking and eating every night til after 2 am we never made it to the breakfast - we were awake but after steak and chips ad midnight we just weren't hungry again until lunchtime the next day! I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again, particularly for the location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrsHSY
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel, for the price range. The staff were very friendly and efficient. Our room had recently been refurbished with a contemporarary feel and although small, (in typical Parisien style) was spotless. I have stayed in other city centre hotels that exceed in price but don't come up to the same standard that you'll find here. It's not luxury but that is reflected in the price. If you're out all day sight seeing and you want to walk back through the centre of Paris to a clean , comfortable room then this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: jefgar
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a week in mid-March 2008 We will definitely stay here again. The room was very clean...basic but comfortable. We were on a higher floor; so traffic noise was not a problem with the windows closed, or even open for the that matter. (I'm a sound sleeper.) The staff is very friendly and helpful, as well as English speaking. The hotel's location can't be beat. Just around the corner is the Monoprix supermarket with many reasonably priced take-out salads, sandwiches, terrific breads and cheeses, etc. The area has pharmacies, bakeries, all kinds of shops. Plenty of nice cafes nearby too. We tried a different one every night for beer/tea/coffee/wine and were never disappointed. One subway stop is basically under the hotel and a big one--Republique-- with several lines intersecting, is five minutes away. From either of these stops, it is an easy and quick trip to the key areas of the city. For a reasonably priced hotel, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: mawie75
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Paris from London on the 17th March, Took 5 min by cab from the train station(Gare du Nord),the hotel very central, 2min to the Metro station and nice bright-clean room await customers,Atm machine just around the corner,Pharmacy across the road, kebab and chinese restaurant next door, and a supermarket just at the back of the hotel.What else you need,plus only 20 min walk to Notre Dame and Musee Du Louvre.And very sexy toilet door ; )

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mtshasta
Reviews.Content: This hotel did the job for a 4-night stay. Location:3rd arrondissement, near Republique metro with easy access to all parts of Paris. Room: very small but adequate; comfortable bed,good shower; toiletries and hairdrier; fresh towels daily. All spotlessly clean. Breakfast: average; pleasant eating area. Staff: friendly and helpful; always available. Value: paid with Airmiles; good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ross2000
Reviews.Content: Being just 2 stars I was worried the hotel wouldn't be very good quality but when we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised. The manager greeted us very warmly, spoke excellent English and was very friendly. The room was clean, modern and to a very good standard. The location was excellent being in the centre of Paris. Overall I would visit again and have recommended it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: louise
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage daughter for three nights on the 5th floor overlooking the main road which was absolutely delightful. The hotel overlooks very pretty Parisian buildings. The street was hardly audible at night and I'm a non drinker/light sleeper! The room was very pretty, tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. The flat screen tv has a vast array of channels. The bathroom was lovely, with a good power shower. The hotel has a beautiful spiral staircase leading to an amazingly cheerful breakfast room which has lovely views of the hotel courtyard. Self service breakfast is plentiful no matter what time you get up. The staff are extremely helpful and the proprietor is genuinely concerned that his guests are comfortable with their stay. The location is superb. The Temple Metro only a few steps away, a large Monoprix supermarket across the road and walking distance to many attractions. The added security of a 24 hour concierge is a bonus. This little hotel is fabulous for the price and more renovations will take place this year to the reception and exterior. The walls are thin but most guests respect this and neighbouring noise is usually minimal. We highly recommend this bijou hotel for a short break and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: WillGowing
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised at some of the negative reviews on this hotel. I thought the hotel was great value, it was also a great location for my needs i.e. right outside of Temple Metro and only a 5 minute walk to Republique Metro (which takes you straight to Gare Du Nord). The hotel is simple - don't expect The Dorchester if you're paying for a Travel Lodge. Nice room though with plasma TV, good powerful shower and a very comfortable bed. It wasn't noisy at all for me - I stayed on the third floor - however I do like a drink so maybe I'm not the best guest to pass comment on that one! Overall though good value and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Diving_Cyclist
Reviews.Content: We found a pay-for-2-stay for-3-night special on a European website (Turquoise Tours and Travel, out of London). Total cost for two adults, including breakfast, was $285. The hotel is situated less than 100 meters from the metro station Temple, or about 250 meters from the metro Republique. Our flight from the US arrived at CDG at 9:45 a.m. and at 11:10 a.m. we checked into the hotel. Hotel staff is very friendly and appeared to appreciate our speaking French to them but obviously spoke English well. The room was rather small but not too small--typical size for Paris. It was not claustrophobic. Quiet windows, a very clean and modern bathroom, very nice shower, daily fresh towels, soap, and shampoo; comfortable (=firm) Queen-sized bed. (Note: The hotel has no rooms for three persons or more.) Small flat screen TV with lots of cable offerings; good lighting in the room; only one AC outlet; free WiFi in the hotel, included in price. Breakfast (great coffee, OJ, cereal, croissant, cheese, eggs, jams, bread, joghurt, no meats) is served in a bright, totally newly refurbished breakfast room--very happy, clean, and just refreshing. There's an outside veranda for the sumer months. The location of the hotel is fabulous: A Velib bicycle station is located maybe 50 meters away, giving you immediate access to the Latin Quarter (10 min), Marais (6 to 7 min), Opera (15 min), Louvre (10 min). neighborhood is safe, relatively quiet. There's a large Monoprix grocery store just around the corner, 2 min walk. We've stayed in lots of different places in Paris and this is our new favorite (apart from the two in-town Hilton properties, but you don't get in there for this price. :)) We'd highly recommend this property, especially if you can score a "deal" the way we did.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: juecart
Reviews.Content: I realise that it is only a 2 star hotel, but the experience could have been much better. Booked this Hotel through Airmiles. So We were expecting a really good standard of hotel albeit the 2 star status. Also we booked on the understanding the hotel was actually in the Marais which is the area we wanted to be for socialising at night. this was not the case. It was at best on the very edge of the marais and was 2 metro stations away. The room was tiny, The bathroom flooded every time we took a shower. Also the room was right next to the lift shaft which was very very noisy. Also I think anytime used the toilet in any other room. the smell was shared to our room. that is the most polite way I can think of to write what I am trying to say I think if you request a front view you will have the busy main road, But less likely to hear the noise of the lift. The hotel lobby and public area's were very nice, the staff very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. Help with Taxi's and directions. Nothing was a problem to them. The breakfast room was lovely and modern. The breakfast was very good. The hotel is quite central. Having Temple metro right next to the hotel and the main Republique only a 5 minute walk away. We used the Metro a lot and found it easy to use. I hope this review helps anyone reading.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: GinaZ41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights as it was good value and one of the only places we could book (stayed the week before the big Rugby final). First time to Paris and so cannot compare this to anything else. The room was small, but managable. The decor was nice (a budget boutique hotel). The bathroom had been recently redone and was quite nice, very modern. But the noise! We stayed on the first floor (they did not have a room higher up) and facing Turbigo. The staff said, "Just shut the windows and it will be quiet", but not so. I guess they are used to it. I slept with earplugs all four nights, but my husband did not and he managed to sleep alright. We skipped the breakfast as there are many great little cafes/patissieries just steps away. The metro is close. Most staff were very helpful. I attempted to speak in my dismal French, but they were happy to communicate in their excellent English. Next time we go to Paris, I'll do much more research and will book further ahead of time to find a place on a quieter street.

Reviews.Title: “loud”
Reviews.Author: indisguise
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice, but the hotel room was really loud due to the street outside and the bed was not comfortable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: zeezee88
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend decided to visit Paris for a weekend, before my friend went off to uni. We didn't have much money to spend and as the hotel was quite cheap we were prepared for the standards to be low...but oh, were we wrong! The room was small and the bathroom even smaller (thankfully me and my friend have been friends for 16 years, so being in the space that size for 3 days wasn't an issue + we didn't spend heaps of time in the room anyway) and everything was clean and modern. The breakfast room had just been rennovated and the food was very good. The staff were very friendly and helpful: we even spent about an hour chatting with the receptionist on the front desk one evening as he gave us tips on places to go/phrases to use etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris for a short break. The location is great (5-10 minutes from good bars and restaurants, including a McDonalds for all those who "have" to have one) and 20-30 minutes walk from major shopping districts and attractions. it has excellent transport links (at each end of the road on which the hotel is situated there is a metro link: Temple & Art St. Metiers) and a further 2 minutes up the road there is a main line metro station: Republique, which enables you to connect with most of Paris. Good points: Clean, Comfortable, Modern, Excellent transport links, close to cafes/bars/restaurants. Bad points: Small, the walls are quite thin so neighbouring rooms can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “a great value”
Reviews.Author: gbs4
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris 2-3 times/ year and stayed at many different places over the years. Recently moved from the Left Bank to staying in either the 3rd or 11th Arr. I was in Paris by myself for a few days so I decided to try this hotel. it was pretty much as expected. Great location, small rooms (I upgraded to the "deluxe double" for an extra 15Euros and was glad that I did). Biggest complaint was that my room which was on rue Turbigo was quite noisy (I slept with ear plugs so it was fine). Big surprise: the front desk. They couldn't be nicer and there was always someone there to let me in (I have stayed in many 3 and 4 star hotels where if i came in very late -and paris is a late nite city- I have had to bang on the door and wake someone up to be let in. Not here even when I came back one morning at 3:30AM there was someone at the front desk.). Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for someone where price is a primary consideration.

Reviews.Title: “18th Birthday in Paris”
Reviews.Author: scarlet_starlet27
Reviews.Content: After the hectic CDG airport it was nice to get to the hotel! The Relais du Marais is a very pretty hotel in the centre of Paris, just down from the Place de la Republique. My friends and stayed there for two nights for my 18th birthday and really liked the atmosphere of the hotel. The hotel itself was lovely, the old spiral stairs were beautiful, despite us being on the 4th floor! The staff were very helpful with every request we had - especially the convienence of a luggage room. The rooms were very well presented, if a little small and the bathrooms were extremely clean with new fixtures and fittings. All this with a bonus of an atmospheric view of some of older Paris. The breakfast rooms were very modern which suited our younger tastes and the selection of food was good. The situation of the hotel is perfectly situated for enjoying all of Paris with great metro links nearby. We were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: wikusdutoit
Reviews.Content: Awesome little hotel with a beautiful breakfast room with funky perspex chairs. Small lift but the rooms are great and literally a few stap away from TEMPLE metro station. Will recommend and stay again! Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: daramada
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay in Paris and at this hotel. Great location, close to the metro and supermarket etc. After reading other reviews of this hotel it seemed the best rooms were at the front so that is what we asked for and that is what we got. The guys on the front desk could not have been more helpful or friendly. Every day the staff took an interest in us which made our stay fun as we could practice our limited french. English was spoken as well. I was travelling with my daughter who loved the modern glass breakfast room as well as the breakfast. She rated our european hotel stays by the breakfast and this hotel rated highly. We would recommend this hotel as well as stay there again if we were lucky enough to be able to return to Paris. I booked our room through a pre paid internet option so the rate was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Grand little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CedricAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend invited me for a citytrip to Paris in February 2007. She picked out this little hotel next to Place de la Republique in the Marais. Although I'm not that often in Paris, I've been in a few 2 and 3 star hotels there. And let me tell you: Le Relais du Marais will exceed your expectations. As long as you keep in mind that you're in the city centre, meaning you won't expect an ocean of room, that is. The hotel staff is very friendly. My speaking French was appreciated and made them treat us in a familiar way. They are young, and know what young couples want. The staff has been very helpful in providing nice dinner addresses and offers. Be amused by their little stories on how they go through a world of trouble to reserve a table in a fine restaurant around the corner (very cute and delicious food, with the chef taking care of his customers personally). Obviously they have some common understanding. Breakfast was served in a modern style kitchen-dining room with fresh, simple furniture. Take a moment to savor one of their croissants, or munch on a 'petit pain au chocolat'. The rooms are definitely ok for a 2*+ hotel, though the one negative point I could make is the door separating bedroom and bathroom could have been repainted/replaced. Conclusion: Excellent quality/price, young, fresh and simple. Enjoy while it's there!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: MaryQofS
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a 3 night stay, Thursday- Sunday having stayed in Paris 3 times before but at different hotels. The best thing about the Relais is the friendliness and enthusiasm of the staff- they appear genuinely nice and helpful. Our room was also spotlessly clean throughout our stay. Our en suite room on the 2nd floor (25) was freshly decorated and although small had everything we needed for a short stay. The only downside for us was that were very aware of the traffic noise even with the window closed and if we'd been staying longer would have asked for a quieter room. Breakfast served in the dining room was a good start to the day- our kids would love the bright/funky decor. The hotel is centrally located and also handy for the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic price, location, and great room!”
Reviews.Author: heythisisnate
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it. This was the second hotel of our 4-night stay in Paris ... we decided to try one Left-bank and one Right-bank hotel, but now I wish we spent the whole time at Relais du Marias. We spent quite a bit of time reading reviews on TripAdvisor, and all of the good things said about this hotel we found to be true. Checking in, the man at the front desk was extremely friendly. I do speak a little bit of french (it has been 5 or 6 years though) and when in Paris, I always make an attempt to converse in French, but most parisians will immediately respond in English as soon as they hear my terrible accent. This guy was very nice, and spoke in slow clear french that I could understand (he did speak English, too). The room was small, as has been noted in other reviews, but it's Paris and that is to be expected. It was plenty big enough for us and our stuff. Our room had a lot of light from a large window that opens, and a little desk and decent sized closet. The bathroom was also very bright and clean, it had a good bathtub/shower and was appointed with clean towels and little soaps. Possibly the best feature ... free high-speed WiFi internet on every floor. Worked great. Bring a european power adapter for your laptop or you can buy one at a place like FNAC. Our rate included breakfast, and I would definitely recommend it. The breakfast room was decorated very modern, with tables and chairs from IKEA. Breakfast was typical french and buffet style ... coffee, croissants, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, yougurt, and orange juice. Location is absolutely perfect for walking or taking the Velib bikes around. The Marais is a beautiful neighborhood with lots of cute stores, restaurants, and cafes. For the price, this place was fantastic. I'll definitely come back on my next Paris trip.

Reviews.Title: “Walker's paradise”
Reviews.Author: QualityManagerLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was an Air Miles recommended hotel and a few minute's walk from the Gare du Nord where the Eurostar arrives. It is pretty central for the price and we walked all the tourist trail from here with ease. Handy for the subway and the river it was ideal for us. The staff, reception and breakfast room are all fantastic. The en-suite room we had was OK but could have been so much better with one day's decorating. Aircon was good and the road traffic acceptable when the double glazing was closed for the night. Would definitely recommmend to a friend and go again.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: helennewmansa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for three nights at Le Relais du Marais. The room was nice with a good view from the balcony, and the breakfasts were good. It was a good base from which to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, shame we didn't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Drewbin
Reviews.Content: We booked this because it was in the heart of the marais district, when we arrived we were told that are booking has been changed and we were staying in the "Le Molay" around the corner, we also had a friend that booked the same hotel and his booking also got changed. I think that if you want a good hotel book "Le Molay" rue de achieves, just minutes from the Gay District. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: grey_traveller_7
Reviews.Content: The best feature here are the friendly and helpful staff. We found Room 51 to be too dark - even though recently refurbished like the rest of the hotel, it was very claustrophobic with only a small window looking nowhere, but the staff did their very best to move us to a front room which they managed for our final night. The front rooms (we had 55) are terrific and the double-glazing means the street noise is not a problem. Breakfast was very good and the cleaning staff also great. With a room fronting the street, we would stay here every time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: CBSCLSVLSNJS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais 10 thru 13 July, 2007 (one double and one twin room). All members of staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts are typical continental buffet style and plentiful. Rooms on the small side (no drawers - only wardrobes) but the bathrooms more than make up for this. Position - can't be faulted - seconds away from Temple and 3 minutes from Republique. Many restaurants, brasseries, supermarkets within easy walking distance. No complaints at all - will certainly use this hotel again when I re-visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: STARKEY
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading some trip advisor reviews.The room we had was agood size in comparison to other Paris hotels we have stayed in and though it needs redecorating ,it was clean and comfortable with a modern bathroom.Areas of the hotel were being painted and rooms that have not been upgraded will be in the future.The one next to us had been completed and looked lovely.The staff are marvellous-friendly,funny and extremely helpful.The location is good with lots ofattractions nearby and 2 metro stations to choose from.Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: kittycat1961
Reviews.Content: I will not bore you with all the details since several others have already covered the important stuff. I will say that we had the best room in the place which is #64. There are three rooms like this that have been renovated and there are plans to continue with the other rooms. If you look at their website you will see the room that we had. I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights with my 16 year old daughter. I would be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parais Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: EB83
Reviews.Content: The Relais is in a great location in the Marais district, close to two metros (Arts and Metiers + Temple) and within walking distance of the Picasso museum. Neighborhood isn't too crazy, and there are great patisseries and grocers nearby. Owner was very friendly and accomodating - upon departure, he got us a cab and white wine while waiting! Rooms are large; a plus to the bed sheets (comfy) and bathrooms (large, with north american electrical outputs!). Highly recommended, and worth paying a bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Central, friendly, happening”
Reviews.Author: Sitbone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days. Like most buildings in the older neighborhoods, it had 5 stories. It has an elevator (small by US standards but large by Parisian standards--easily fits two adults and baggage) which is really important if you end up on the 5th floor as we did. Like all Paris hotel rooms, it was much smaller than a US standard, but ours was quite charming--nicely decorated bathroom, a small writing table, a closet wardrobe and french-door windows with a low wrought iron fence around a small ledge. Our reservations included the price of breakfast (not always so, you may want to check the price first otherwise), and the breakfast had a very nice variety of items--croissants, pain au chocolat, mini-baguettes, butter, soft cheese, yogurt, cereal, milk, coffee, hot water for tea, hot milk for hot chocolate, and various confits (jellies and jams) and the omnipresent but must-have nutella (try it on the croissants). I actually found their breakfast better than the breakfast menu--which means a set breakfast usually of coffee, juice, croissant or pain au chocolat and/or buttered baguettes offered at a set price--found at the nearby cafes. The entire staff was friendly and polite--from the front desk managers to the cleaning crews--it gave the hotel a very nice relaxed atmosphere. The managers spoke English fairly well and they were very helpful with directions and questions. The hotel itself if a half-block (if that) from the Temple Metro station and a mini half-block further to the Republique Metro station (a larger station which services more than one line). The hotel is on a side street (quieter) but very close to the Place de la Republique, around which there are cafes, boulangeries (bakeries) a bank (for those ATM withdrawals), bistros, a Monoprix (like a small upscale Target which came in very handy), and boutiques of the expensive and dirt-cheap varieties. There is even a MacDonald's (if you really must) further along the Republique circle. The nearby metro stations were great for getting to places like Notre Dame, Il de la Cite, Eiffel Tower, etc. Marais itself is often hopping, but we ended up spending a Saturday and a Sunday there, so most of the shops on the streets radiating off of the circle were closed then--but nearly all of the shops, cafes, restaurants, bistros, etc. on the circle itself was open. We've heard of accounts of people having much worse accommodations for about the same price we did. If you've done research, you'll know that Paris hotels (particularly ones located in this kind of neighborhood) are pricey. But I think we got a great deal for our (ever-deflating) dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location and close to bars”
Reviews.Author: kevinNyc
Reviews.Content: My name is kevin, My partner and I stayed at the hotel relais du marais from May 26, 27 and 28, 2007. We had a great time. What we liked about the hotel was that it was central in the marais area. The hotel was close to the rue du temple metro and the République metro, which connected us all of paris. I really enjoyed the breakfast and the hotel and rooms where clean. Most inportantly We found the staff to be very helpful. One male staff member who worked over night took the time to go over and mark site seeing locations and direction on both metro and street maps. We would recommend this hotel if you would like to have a comfort and enjoyable stay in Paris. Kevin

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: happy_evil
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 5 nights in the Relais du Marais. Location is good: 2 mins walk to Temple metro station, 5 mins walk to Republique metro station (5 lines of metro). There is a Monoprix and Post Office on the street behind the hotel, which is really handy. Hotel room in the small size but bathroom is quite big and super clean. It’s quite strange that the bathroom door, is made by frosted glass... It makes the room looks bigger, but I’m not sure that if most people like this idea... There is air condition in the room, or you can open the window. But it’s quite noisy outside so turning the A/C on should be a better idea. Staff at reception are quite friendly and they speak good English. Maids do a good job in cleaning too. I would recommend this hotel to singles, or budget travellers, but not for people with kids.

Reviews.Title: “kind helpfull people”
Reviews.Author: Monisim
Reviews.Content: The people are very kind and helpful. We were not satisfied with the room we got, but then they offered us an other room that was just renewed. This was a most wonderful room, very nicely and careful decorated, with bath and view on the street. Balcony with flowers. Because we are a couple, they asked the cleaning lady to make our bed into a double bed. The hotel is near the metro 'Le Temple', near supermarket and near a very nice park. Close to the beautiful sights of Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Parisiens rude??-mais Non!!”
Reviews.Author: Celiasmith
Reviews.Content: The Relais du Marais is a little treasure of a hotel. I cannot fault it one iota. The staff fall over themselves to help you. The manager is half english/french and was so friendly that it felt that you were a personal friend and not a guest. My room (no 64) was the best in the hotel. Very comfy beds and a bathroom to die for. I was told that all the rooms would be refurbished to the same standard and all the hotel would be very ultra modern. The Manager told me they were aiming for this to be finished in 3 months. Cons: Yes, the lift is small, but so what? It's a lift not a room and it serves it's purpose! The corridors are quite narrow too but it certainly didn't bother me. After all, you need to remember that we are talking about a 2* hotel and it's plus points far outweigh it's minuses. The hotel is in a brilliant location, 2 metro stations nearby and the bus stop is over the road. Takes you to all the sights. Loads of bars/restaurants to choose from. Massive Monoprix over the road that has the biggest bakery I have ever seen and I sure enjoyed trying out their bread and cakes! I went to Paris with my 11 yr old son and I can certainly say we both had a ball, even when we were encore une fois perdu dans le metro! In a nutshell, lovely hotel, beautiful city and friendly people. As Arnie once said - I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: IsraelJoe
Reviews.Content: this hotel is 2 stars but gives you more like 3 *** the owner and manager is very kind and helpful, the stuff are kind and all together you get wonderful hotel, clean and nice. the location is very good - you have the metro by walk and you can get allot of lines that take every place in the city. take this hotel it worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Hotel With Personality”
Reviews.Author: tjdibo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a week while we were on our honeymoon in Paris. This little hotel was wonderful, great service, very friendly staff and would ask any questions that they could, good buffet breakfast, and the staff spoke very good English. The rooms were pretty small but what european hotels arn't. This hotel is pretty far from the Eiffel Tower and other attractions so I would suggest getting a subway pass to see everything this wonderful city has to offer. This hotel could very easily be a 4* and I would stay here again the next time we go to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Le Relais du Marais in Feb of this year. The hotel is in a great location, directly beside Place de la Republique. The decor and furnishings are a bit dated and the rooms are a bit small (this seems to be the norm in Paris from my experience) but then again I didn't travel to Paris to stay inside a hotel room and look at furniture. One negative aspect was that I had specifically requested when booking a room that was not facing onto the main road as I didn't want to be subjected to traffic noise. However, on arrival, I was given a room at the front of the hotel. The staff in general were friendly, particularly one guy who worked there who had impeccable English. I tried speaking French to him but in the end gave up because his English was so much better than my French!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisF
Reviews.Content: We booked Le relais du Marias through Airmiles and stayed there for 3 nights last week (March 2007). The hotel is classed as 2 star so we were not expecting too much but were pleasantly surprised. All the reception staff were polite and helpful and many spoke english but were also happy to listen to our stuttering attempts at french! The room was average size, clean and the bathroom was also fine. Breakfasts were good in the very modern breakfast room. Excellent location. Close to the Metro but also walking distance to the Seine. Monoprix supermarket close by to purchase those delicious french goodies to take home! We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “happy stay”
Reviews.Author: AT-7
Reviews.Content: I must thank you for the Tripadvisor & everybody who had voiced their remarks here before helped me to make the choice of 5 nights stay in Le Relais Du Marais. ALL staff are exceptionally friendly & helpful, special thanks to funny charming Anyl & Khslen. My room kept very clean/tidy everyday (I appreciated a lot) location easy access to everything. The lock did really got big noise so I made it carefully every night I returned my room so my neighbor should not hear that like alarm. : ) I traveled long way Paris from Hong Kong and I could sleep like pig everynight. Please keep up the good work and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Price & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: StanInLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having researched budget hotels in the Marais area on all the usual hotel sites and looking on Trip Advisor. The other reviews were good and we agreed! The hotel was easy to get to on foot from Gare du Nord (Eurostar) (about 15 minutes) and Gare du l'est (10 Mins) and from Place de la Republique (2 mins). The hotel was clean and comfortable with a very good breakfast included. The room was clean and modern looking with plasma tv with DVD player and windows opening out onto the street (although you could walk to the room next door from the balcony if you wanted). The only downside to the room was the sound of water gushing down the pipes from rooms above - if you are lucky they may wake up late! The ensuite shower room was clean and functional. The hotel was located easy walking distance from Hotel de Ville, Notre Dame and Pompidou Centre and if you are feeling energetic you can easily walk to most of the main sights and shops (or jump on the Metro from one of the 2 local stations)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: WB-10
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel twice and would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone. The level of customer service and friendliness is exceptional. It has a great location - just off Republique with 2 Metro stations to choose from. Very well managed and spotlessly clean. The newly refurbished breakfast room is the best I have ever seen in this type of property. The choice and freshness of the food/drink is equally as good.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Three Within 14 Months”
Reviews.Author: Guest_Writer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in three hotels in Paris within the last 14 months and this one was my favorite. The other two were three star hotels (Hotel Beaubourg, Hotel Delavigne) while this one is a two star hotel and priced accordingly. I wouldn't turn anyone away from the other two, however I preferred this hotel because the rooms, and the bathrooms, are newly renovated, bright, clean and handsome, because the housekeeping was impeccable, and especially because everyone who worked there was VERY kind and VERY helpful--most notably, Anyl, Hakim and Gloria. Some of the staff at the other two hotels were disagreeable. You can believe the advertising when they write free WIFI. I was able to use it 80% of the time in my room and when the reception was too weak, it was simple and comfortable to use it in the lobby (good reception 100% of the time). Some rooms are smaller than others, but totally in line with the rest of Parisian hotels. The location is superb, a skip and a jump from "La Republique," and if your being economical, there is a Monoprix next door. There were no problems with the invoice, I paid exactly the rate that I booked on the internet. If this is your price range and the right location for you, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Area”
Reviews.Author: StevieDScotland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night trip at Le Relais du Marais and can honestly say i was not disappointed. As with many other travellers, i was somewhat apprehensive in choosing a hotel from so many but the hotel was ideal for our price range and length of stay, thanks to the help of Trip Advisor. Having visited Paris several times previously, staying either within the Montparnasse or St Germain districts, i thought a change would be best. The hotel was easy to find, the metro stations of Republique and Temple very close by, and the room was adequate, not big by any means but clean, tidy with an ensuite that included a bath. Breakfast was typically French with cereal, croissants, coffee, tea etc and was ideal. The hotel staff were great, their English very good and more than helpful. As for the area itself, there are plenty of cafes, bars and shops at the main Repubique Square as well as along the rue du Turbigot. Easy to find and suit all tastes but would recommend the Temple cafe opposite the hotel as well as a small and typically French restaurant one block away whose name escapes me, think it was Le Sommeilles, but was recommended to me by the hotel staff. Absolutely great food and not too bad price wise (90 euros for 3 courses + wine). As for getting around the city, we jumped on the metro (best to ask for a 'carnet' - 10 metro tickets - cost 10 euros) and bought ticket for open top bus. This allows you to get around the city stopping off at most of the main attractions. You can get the red bus at Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame, Opera and Eiffel Tower to name some of the stops. It cost 22 euros and you get the use of the bus for 2 days. In summary, a good hotel to use as a base, in a good area and would recommend. That said, still prefer St Germain area for its close knit atmosphere but that's a personal choice. PS booked through Air miles and got a great cash price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lily&jonathon
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay here was a real pleasure. Our first impression was of ultra friendly, extremely helpful staff, who don't mind catering to non-French speaking tourists. Having stayed in Paris before we've been used to tiny rooms. This, however, was a good size and included a bath! Windows are double-glazed, so although the hotel is central and on a main road you can get a good night's sleep. One of the highlights is the breakfast room (see for yourself!). One downside was the booking agent took 100% of the fee upon booking the hotel, dunno if that has anything to do with hotel policy or not but we'd HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone!

HotelInfo.Name: Le Relais du Marais
HotelInfo.Address: 76 rue de Turbigo, 75003 Paris, France
